name: Chance Lesser
text: Best Sushi in Tuscaloosa

name: Walter Graham
text: First time there. Had steak and was really good. Had a great salad. Service was great. Great place to eat

name: Moe Nelson
text: Great place. Nice atmosphere. Great food and drinks with reasonable prices.  Workers was very polite they made you feel welcome and at home. I will definitely go back again

name: robert tabb
text: The food was horrible The service was horrible, not a great place for a first visit especially if you are a person of color. . Super disappointed

name: David Perry
text: Cozy steakhouse with full bar, great food, and friendly staff. Will definately return!

name: Ashley Welborn
text: Good Food quick Service.

name: Jonathon Moore
text: This place was awful and steak wasn’t to good either mix drinks suck and service suck will not be back

name: Doyle Truelove
text: Austin's is a nice place to eat with a relaxing atmosphere. Not over crowded which means no waiting time. The food is good and ready in a reasonable length of time.

name: Lanny Sasser
text: Best steak in Livingston. Great food at reasonable prices.

name: Doug Nunley
text: Tuesday night wing night is top notch! Delicious wings and only 50 cents each!

name: Lynn Leher
text: One of the best filets I've ever eaten a d the service was amazing! Don't miss this fantastic find!

name: Clay Elliott
text: This used to be a great place to eat, but unfortunately it has closed down.

name: Sandria Tyson
text: Hi everyone👋🏼 tonight my husband and I were talking about eating some chicken livers, which are a favorite of ours so since we are new to the area a friend of ours suggested that we should try them from Austin’s so we decided to call in to do a carry out order...we ordered a large chicken liver with French fries plate. Everything looked good so here comes the sample, the food was super crunchy, bland and the grease that they were fried in was old!!! The fries tasted good at least that’s what our daughter said while eating them with the food that she was already eating. It’s a no go for us 🙅🏽‍♀️🙅🏾‍♂️

name: Henry San
text: Don't ever judge a book by its cover. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was amazing. Thank you

name: caroline staggers
text: Delicious food, especially their steaks. Service very good, friendly.

name: Valerie Burnes
text: So glad Austin's is open again!

name: Christi Farias
text: very clean and well lit.

name: alan rubel
text: Great place to stay when you travel

name: Michele Hagood
text: Delicious as always!!

name: Michael Clark
text: Great steaks

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
First time eating here was tonight. We had two servers for our party of six and they did fantastic. Drinks never got low and the went above and beyond our needs. My steak was cooked to perfection and the sides tasted fresh.

It is more expensive than your average steakhouse, but worth the money.

name: David Barnett
text:
This was a really good dining experience. The best I've had in a very long time.

Not only was the food excellent but the service was unbelievable. There were three waiters serving us and they were all professional, friendly, and helpful. It's hard for me to understand others who have rated the service as anything less than stellar.

My hat is off to the entire staff at Shula's.

name: Steph M
text:
The combination hostess/bartender/waitress was a great server. She went out of her way for me.
I went for spinach salad, so I can't comment on the steak aspect, but the salad was really good and the drinks were delicious.

name: Stacy Giovinco
text: Steak was average and very expensive and i have had better.  The desert we ordered was out of this world.  The service was great as well.  Great atmosphere.  Only giving it two three stars bc of the desert and service. My bill was $250 for a two average steaks.

resp.text: Hi Stacy - Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback, we very much appreciate hearing what our customers think.  We're so glad you enjoyed our high level of customer service, the atmosphere and your dessert!  But we want to make sure you loved your steak as well!  We would love the opportunity to have you back to "wow" you with our Shula Cut steaks.  If you would like, please email me directly at kt@shula.com and we can communicate further.  Thank you!   - Kristen Thompson

name: Anita Frederick
text: My husband and I come and enjoy date night about once a month at Shula's we love the atmosphere at the bar and enjoy getting to interact with the bartender and patrons. Our best experience has been with Lindsey who went out of her way to make sure we had great service and learned more about the cocktails we were interested in trying as well as taking our food order and delivering great customer service. We love our date night and can't say enough good things about Shula's.

name: Anna Goloforo
text: They  need to change their  dress code.  Just because we didn't come from work, with a suit or pant suit they wouldn't serve  us.   Well they list about 200!ir more dollars for dinner.  That's not too wise

name: Andrew King
text: Failed to cook a rare Ribeye...... twice!! Manager and server had an attitude when we showed them the overcooked steak. The second steak they served us was cold. Also ordered the Filet Trio (medium-rare). Two were medium and one was well-done.... J. Alexanders has better service and they know how to cook a rare steak. Cheers!

resp.text: Hi Mr. King.  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. We use feedback like this to identify issues and address them.  Your feedback has been forwarded to our executive team and to our Shula’s team in Birmingham.  We would like to follow-up with you on your experience.  If you are open to it, please email me directly at kt@shula.com with your phone number. Thank you! - Kristen Thompson

name: David Aarons
text: Service great.  Food way overrated.  Ruths Chris and J Alexander's steaks are much better.  Would not go back.

name: respect my privacy
text:
Felt I was prejudiced against because I’m white, and my GF is Mexican. We went to Shula’s on Valentine’s day. I made reservations 5 days before which gave me the options of 3 time slots. I took the earlier time. When I arrived, (5 minutes late and we called to say so) we had to wait an additional 15-20 to have our table which gave me the impression that they were busy. There was nobody in the PLACE and we had to wait! Olive Garden, Outback does this too: They make you wait and the place is only half full! They purposely make it seem as if they are busy when in fact out of 16 tables in the back room, only 3 were occupied. There were 2 black couples and us.
The black female waitress didn’t have “her game on” as she expressed to the couple behind me. For $150.00 + you better have your S—t together!  We ordered different wines and she never identified to us which wines they were. She just placed them in front of us and proceeded to take our order. She incorrectly took our order by not remembering. Did not write it down either. I ordered the 14 oz. rib eye grilled Pittsburg style, med-rare. She returned to our table telling me that they gave me the next size steak for the same price of the 14 oz. because she did not remember the order. We’ll  guess that was OK. When it came it was not P-Burg style. I asked for sour cream for the mashed potatoes and she did not bring that as well. I noticed the lack of friendliness to me and my GF compared to her report w/ the other American-African couples. She just did not care,
When I commented to her about the experience, I tried to do so in a kindly fashion. She never listened to my advice. Her response was “you don’t have to tip me”. Well I still tipped , but only 10% for the service. So in closing, the prejudice I felt, the sub-par alacrity, overly apologetic waitress I’d rather go to Flemmings Steakhouse instead.

name: Robert Woods
text:
So my wife and I go there for our anniversary. May 17th 2013. We make reservations for 6:45PM. The weather was bad that afternoon and it was Friday so we decide to go a little early. We arrived at 6:20PM. We walked in at the same time that two ladies staying at the Wynfrey did. They got to the maître d's desk a split second before we did. They told the maître d' that they did NOT have reservations but could they eat anyway. They were told yes. I was asked if we had reservations. I told them my name. We were told to have a seat, they would be with us soon. The two ladies got seated immediately. We had to wait almost 25 minutes! When we got our food, my baked potato was not done completely.

Point being, there is apparently no benefit to making reservations!!!!!

name: Charnessa Mz. Watch Me Campbell
text: First time here and the young lady walked us all the way to our table to sit down, once we sat down, she tells me I can't wear my bball cap which is plan gray with no writing at all, so we left and came to J. Alexander's. Thanks for a first time bad experience.

name: Andrew McCarrell
text: I've always had outstanding food and service at Shula's.  I typically go for lunch.

name: Shelia Clary
text: We went this afternoon only to find they were  not opening until 4 pm. The website saus daily 11:30 to 9:30.... the gentleman insode was rude and said well the sign outside says we open at late on Sunday.... I will not ever go back.

name: Koopa Wesson (Koopa)
text: The best steak I've ever eatin.!!!!!! Amazing!!!

name: Ashton Parsons
text: Took two hours for food to arrive, 13 people. It was embarrassing, VIP room, no one else was here.

name: Adam Waldrup
text: Amazing steakhouse!!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and kind words! We're glad that you enjoyed your experience at Shula's, and we hope to have you back again sometime soon!

name: Bryan Benson
text: Wonderful,  as usual!

name: Stephen
text: I have lived in a lot of cities and have ordered steak out in all of them. This location is the worst location I have ever ordered from. The food is good, but the service is horrible. If you can get them on the phone most of the time they are rude and your delivery time is 1.5 hours + I am sure its just bad management. but I love steak out and will suffer through the BS to get it.

name: Amanda Grace
text: Great food. Relaxed welcoming atmosphere! Worth stopping by!

name: Marty Hoven
text: Great steak and great service. Definitely a family business and they treat you like family!

name: John Henson
text: Great food and service

name: Andy Smith
text: Great food and even better people

name: Alan
text: Best steak I've ever had! Also, all of the staff were very friendly!

name: Alan Johnson
text: No cook only open Friday and Saturday  Apparently closed

name: V Moore
text: Ausome steaks

name: Tara Bragg
text: Great Food

name: Thori Brewer
text: To the best of my knowledge this place is now closed!  Good riddance!  Tried twice to have out of town guest stay here and it was a disaster.  Both time they had to leave before staying the night and the staff did not care!  I have report them closed to Google but they say it can't be confirmed, so it is still listed.

name: Renette Whitehead
text: Stayed a weekend there several years ago but had a good experience. Liked being on the water.

name: debstermax1
text: This restaurant is not worth your time and money.  The prices are outrageous!  Menus are scarce and it is bad when the waitress has to explain that she has to wait for a menu to be available.  We had just moved to the area.  My husband and I tried it on our Anniversary.  We ordered a steak dinner.  The waitress who was the owner sat around with friends chatting at another table while we waited.  When we finally received the meal, the steak was not cooked right and it was not hot, the baked potato would not melt butter.  Flies all over the place.  We asked for a to go box paid our bill,  and went home and finished cooking and eating there.  The owner is a very rude person. She acts like she is drunk and she is not a nice person.  It is not like the website says or the picture, it is nasty, trashy and has a bad reputation in the area for drug deals.  Just ask the local people.  We will never go there again.

name: Casey Wall Orem
text: The lighthouse is a warm and welcoming place. They are renovating still. Since some areas are under light construction they gave us much cheaper rates. Loved our time here

name: Bama Wild
text: Doesn't even deserve a star in my book. Earlier this year my husband and I tried to stay there. dirty, nasty no place to sit your luggage. GROSS FLOORS and showers. the bed had spring sticking out of it. We left in the middle of the night YUCK! is all I have to say. NO REFUNDS and we had paid for 3 days. We didn't care if we lost the money. we just needed to go... Don't eat there either YUCK! DO NOT RECOMMEND! Spaced out crackheads...

name: Danny Schneck
text: When are the crackhead owners of this crap hole going to finally sell this place and let some people who AREN'T felons and drug addicts take over?  This could be a fantastic place if crackheads weren't running it and working there.

name: Suzan Meeks Watson
text: It's a beautiful spot and it's going to be very nice when the renovations are complete!

name: Donnette Reeves
text: Only one waitress.....she seemed nice, but the service and food was terrible. Flies everywhere inside the restaurant! Had to swat to keep them out of our food & sodas. Food definitely wasn't worth the high cost!

name: Darlene Hill
text: A great place  to eat food  very good but just to pricey for today  economy !!

name: B E
text: More like a transient motel with dad's taking the kids to school early in the morning. Flavorless food and staff

name: Michael Hall
text: I have worked and ate here. The food as well as the service is the worst. The owner is a drunk.

name: Susan Calzone
text: It was awful the owner was rude and I have never been treated like that I will never go back!!!!

name: Johnny Chapman
text: it is a Ok place to go eat

name: Brian Wilkey
text: I really liked the place ... was a slow night but food was good and hot .  Service was good ...  I liked the ribs and chopped  chicken.. was sampling citus chicken that I thought was better than chopped chicken and would make a nice option to meat combo...keep up the good work..

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful photos and review!

name: Nathanael Proctor
text: Great food with generous portions! Great atmosphere! You won't leave here hungry.

name: Savannah Beddingfield
text: Delicious! Fresh cut fries 😋. I ordered the Savannah fries (for obvious reasons...lol) and they were amazing. I chose the chopped pork for mine and it was loaded down with BBQ, cheese, and a little sour cream. As a South Carolina girl raised on yellow, mustard based BBQ...I'm very leary of other regions and their sauces...but this place has a great sauce recipe. Loved it!!!

name: Suzanne Calhoun
text: We love Fireman's BBQ! The food's great especially the rib eye and the staff are wonderful!

name: Brianna Picht
text: Pulled pork plate with extremely delicious sweet potato fries and yummy mac and cheese. Messed up our order a bit but it resulted with extra food.

name: Pamela Perez
text: Wow! Unexpected in Greenville...great bbq, highly recommend. Topped off our order with a piece of homemade pound cake, so moist you could have wrung out half a glass of milk n butter. Try the spicy bbq sauce...

name: Matthew Beddingfield
text: Nice place, great food! I had the sampler plate of ribs, brisket, pork, and chicken BBQ. Slice of cake included was a nice touch.

name: Dawn McGough
text: Loaded bbq tater is AWESOME. So is the ribeye!

name: Michelle Little
text: Good food. The prices are high but its enough food to share!!!

name: Lee Eartis
text: Great experience.

name: Gary Haskew
text: Great food

name: Carol Barrett
text: Delicious!

name: Jessica Halo
text: This was my second visit, the first was in march. Very similar results. My spouse and associates ordered 12 oz ribeyes. I ordered a 8oz filet. All were cooked perfectly to our specifications. There was a steak topping/dressing/accompaniment that was not in the description; possibly it was sauteed mushroom pieces. possibly just grill remnants from previous food cooked. There was not a pile of it, but it was on all four steaks that came to our table. It did not bother me or associates and had no overwhelming flavors but my spouse scraped it off because of an aversion to mushrooms, onions, and anything else that could be misunderstood. I chose aspaeagus and salad as sides. My asparagus was tender-crisp and well trimmed. Salad was basic using Iceberg. Had a couple ugly pieces i picked out but nothing major. I had ranch dressing which was homemade but not fantastic nor horrible. There was some dried herb or flavor that did not seem authentic to my ranch tastes but it was edible. I would like to try their  porterhouse but im just not ready to pay $38 for one steak. Overall, very nice meal for 20 minutes down the road. I will be back.  Below is a pic from march.

name: Christina Morales
text: Steak with sauteed mushrooms so freaking good!! This place is amazing

name: Yvonne Adams
text: We've been several times and have really enjoyed it. I have ordered something different even time, and everything has been great. Atmosphere is good - casual and very friendly. It isn't fast, so don't plan to hurry, but the food us worth the wait. Live music on the weekends on outside stage is fun for any crowd. It has become one of our favorite places, especially for hanging out with friends!

name: Didn't Say
text: The restaurant itself,  appearance,  was very nice.  You got a nice down to earth country vibe.  Friendly service,  nice people.  The food however,  was not all that.  I ordered the streak nachos and was served homemade potato chips that were way over cooked. And i ordered the chicken parm, the chicken was dry and it came with a house salad that the waitress didn't even bring out.

name: John Lynch
text:
Ordered appetizer and food at same time. Nearly 30 minutes later, asked where appetizer was. A couple that came in after us received their food about this time. Finally our appetizer showed up. It was sub-par. 30 minutes later, still no food. The host went and got our salads and brought to table. Explained that this wait time was unacceptable. There was approximately 25-30 customers, with several empty tables. Our server tried to tell us that the other couple had not ordered an appetizer like we had. She explained that she couldn't put in our food order until we got the appetizer we had to beg to get! She then went on to say "And there are a lot of people in here!" I looked around again, but just didn't see a lot of people. After requesting to speak with manager, and explaining the situation, we just asked to pay for our salads and appetizer. That's when our food came out!
This was our first and LAST visit! Unacceptable!

name: Michael Escott
text: The service and food is great!  Eric was our waiter and on the spot.  My wife and I enjoyed a Porterhouse steak that was seasoned  and cooked perfectly.  I went with medium rare and she did medium.   We have a few restrictions with our diet currently and asked for oil and vinegar for dressing for our salad.  It wasn't something they offered, but was willing to accommodate us and made us a dressing that was wonderful.  Definitely will be back here.  It is a great addition to the Fort Mitchell area.

name: Detra McKissic
text: I love this hometown restaurant... Nice friendly atmosphere... Had the pleasure of having a server name Mack wait our table ... He was outstanding! Very attentive to our table and didn't miss a beat.... THANKS MACK...

name: Heidi WuzHere
text: We always enjoy going here. Usually the ribs are loved by anyone that goes with me and I like the appetizer Cajun crab legs as my meal. They are always friendly when serving you and it's always a nice experience. 😊

name: aniyah
text: Food is great and so is the service. I would give five stars but it wasn't open three times when the website said it would be. Otherwise it is a great place and I highly recommend.

name: Michael Lake
text: It was a very busy Friday night and took our party of three about an hour to be seated. Appetizer came fairly quickly but main course took about an hour and a half longer to be brought to the table. The steaks were not done well and fries were dry and overcooked. Our waitress was given an opportunity to explain the extreme delays but passed it off as a busy night rather than a lost order or perhaps having to raise and slaughter the animals all in one night. This has been one of the worst dining experiences I have had in years, maybe ever!

name: T. Pugh
text: Great food with unique atmosphere and great service. Good bar for those that aren't driving. Steaks are awesome.

name: Telissa Harper
text: Love this place... Great food... Service is great... If you ever go ask for Julie... Shes my favorite...

name: Kaleb King
text: This place is definitely worth the drive and the wait on food. Great music venue too. I give it a strong 5 stars.

name: Jessica Hergott
text:
The food is always enjoyable and we’ve never have poor service, quite the opposite, however, the kitchen seems to be terribly slow even with a small crowd. Four tables being served and it took 25 minutes for our appetizers. This is the norm for us and what we tell ppl. “The food is good but if you don’t have the time to wait, it’s
not a good choice.”

name: If Lin
text: Nice steak and service.

name: joel brown
text: I visited Fred and Lester’s upon arriving back to Ft Benning from Iraq.  It’s atmosphere is country as corn pone which I like and the steak was superb!  Best steak in the Columbus/Phoenix City area.

name: RP JIII
text: Food was good and service so so. Took awhile to get menus, didnt have certain items on the menu, and waitress forgot one of our house salads. Took awhile for the food but it was tasty. Dont know if I would return.

name: Rachel N
text: No longer Fred n Lesters. Service was great. Food on the other hand was horrible. My husband and I both ordered steaks that came out bleeding. Sent them back. Got them again only to have to send them back a second time. By this time the steaks are burnt on the outside and still undercooked.... I woukd have rather them took their time than to "rush" so we could have our steaks with our food. "Throw the whole steak away"

name: Michael Jackson
text: Will never go back.  Service was ridiculously slow.  Waitress seemed to be trying but was not properly trained.  Waited more than an hour and was told they were out of baked potatoes.  Then later told that they were out of ribs.  Too far to drive for a poorly managed restaurant where our business is not appreciated.  Did I mention no manager came to explain or apologize?

name: Lesley Elizabeth
text: This was our 3rd time here and it's been about 2 years since our last visit. The menu has changed! No more bone in ribeye which was disappointing! We had 13 people in our party! We waited 30 minutes for our drinks as we watched 2 of the 3 girls behind the bar eat. They assigned the "new girl" to our party who was very sweet and tried very hard to please all of us and her other tables. She was not old enough to serve alcohol and the other staff definitely didn't care about her or us or the fact that we were sitting with no drinks after driving 30 minutes to visit a place we had a wonderful time previously! Of course they told us it was her first night alone after things fell apart! Then 3 others tried to help her! That added even more confusion! All of the tickets were mixed up and finally 1 male server stepped up to help her! The wait staff should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to happen! More organization is a must and a staff who's main concern is the satisfaction of ALL guests should be a priority! This experience was nowhere near as good as our first 2. The food was definitely not as good, my potato was even so burnt it was inedible. (Literally black on the bottom through the skin to the inside & as hard as the table!) And steaks that were not what we were expecting (They did have good flavor and were cooked a perfect medium rare!) After completing the payment process, we sat outside and listened to 2 guys play some live music. This was a very nice outdoor entertaining space! Completely changed for the better from our previous visit.

name: Brian Moriarity
text: Very slow service from our server. Unique location good food.

name: Michelle Boutwell
text: It's a good family place and good place to eat as well we will be having band night every Friday Night so come visit us

name: Keith Edmonds
text: Took the family and had the filet, the chop, and the fantail shrimp. Everyone cleaned their plate. Five star food and five star service.

name: Al Banks
text: Excellent service! Great food! Reasonable priced food and steak

name: James Lowe
text: It's great beings it's not fred and Lester's anymore it is now jrs steakhouse of fort Mitchell.

name: Lydia Boll
text: I was so sad about my visit tonight. My husband and I love this place. Normally the service is wonderful. Tonight was another story. We waited almost 10 minutes to get sat. When the waitress finally came to seat us she explained that they were short staffed so there was a little bit of a wait. I understand that, I've been a waitress before. After we sat down we waited at least 30 minutes before our drink order was taken. And even then it was the owner that finally came over to take it. After that it was another 20 or so minutes before the waitress came over to take our food order. Two tables were sat almost 30 minutes after us and received their drinks right away. We sat waiting for our food to come out for another 20 minutes before our appitizers came. The waitress then said that there were no more mashed potatoes, which is what my husband and I had ordered for our sides. We asked for baked potatoes instead. They were also out of that. Ok things happen. So we decided on fries and chips instead. Not even 5 minutes later the table behind us, one of the tables who was sat 30 minutes after us, got their food. Which included both mashed potatoes and baked potatoes. Up until this point we were a little annoyed but fine, this made it much worse. We had mostly lost our appetites by this time. We mentioned to the waitress about all of this and she apologized. Nothing was done to try and rectify the situation though. I would also like to make clear the fact that it was not very busy then we got there at about 8:30 so I did not understand why everything took so long. I am disappointed because we love the food here. I'll have to think long and hard about coming back.

name: Antonio Vazquez
text: Steaks are unequaled! Friendly staff fast service.

name: Will Jones
text: Good food...the waitress was fairly new, but gave ok service

name: Roberta Fletcher
text: Great little mom and pop place! Love the food and the staff.

name: lashawnda thomas
text: Great good even greater service thank you Drucilla

name: Robert Chlebos
text: Ok food good service.

name: Kevin Smith
text: Fred and Lester's business is closed as of October 2018.  There is a new business in the location now.

name: Peanut Butter
text: went for steaks they were very good atmosphere is great

name: Jacob Reigart
text: Called JRs steakhouse now. Very good food and service.

name: Teresa Sebastian
text: It's now JR Steakhouse and the food keeps getting better and better! I think everyone should give JR's a try!

name: Dezarae Edwards
text: The food was amazing fresh and seemed to be made from scratch.

name: Daniel McMahon
text:
There food is very good. I do have to add that I'm very disappointed tho I have been here twice about an hr after they opened and they were out of porterhouse stakes witch happen to be my all time favorite stake. All I got was I'm sorry were out! no compensation for driving all the way out there (45min frive for me)for a steak wanted all I asked for was to upgrade one of toppings eather the  shrimp or crawfish topping they said sorry we can't.
The second time I went out there first thing I asked before we were even seated do you have porterhouse. The waitress stated yes! So my brother and I ordered porterhouses to be turned down five minutes later because they were out.
And they could have a good beer selection but the beers I wanted to go out of too.
I hope that the two times that I have visited this place was just bad luck but as of right now this is very poor Matt list because they didn't have anything on their menu that I wanted
I would like to give it more stars the food was good but just due to the fact that I've been there twice and they don't have the options on the menu that I like and want this is very poor with me

name: Terrell Harris
text: Great atmosphere and great food!

name: Brittney Coleman
text:
Prices are way too high for a steak, especially when it's nothing but fat, no meat. Appetizer wings are delicious though,  they are battered in ranch and buffalo sauce 😋
Staff was short so waiting times were longer than expected.
Sadly, will not be returning!

name: David Gulley
text: Great food, great service, live music. And you don't have to break open your pigebank....

name: JR Hayes
text: Food only warm when brought to table, stake not every good. Overall not good. Will not go eat there again.

name: Mr Wheeler
text: I had a very nice time at the pub. The staff are attentive, and smiling. I had the smoked tuna, very delicious, i will ask for more pita chips(fried) the next time. It is served with a fire roasted tomato sauce, also very very delicious. I chose the 12oz Ribeye, Medium Well, had a bit more char than wanted, should have asked for medium. The beef is locally farmed, and was very good. I will try the shrimp and filet mignon next visit. They dont have housemade dressings anymore... hence I wont rate 5 stars. also homemade lemonade was ok.  i will return and highly recommend. You will spend about $70-80 for two without drinks, but its worth it in my opinion.  has bar area

name: Frank Mary Richardson (Custom Woodcrafters)
text: The food was delicious and the service was so good too.

name: Jeff Lewis
text: Very good food and atmosphere.

name: Ginny Crews
text: Very good food!!  The service was awesome!!

name: Beverly Gillens
text: Awesome food! Great drinks! Fantastic music!

name: Kressa Peterson Sport Horses
text:
My husband and I were traveling to the Military based Spartan Race and found this restaurant online and we LOVE a good steak house. This was NOT it. We had no idea what to expect and we did read other reviews that complained about the price but we have no issue, if the service is good and the food is quality, so we headed over to Fred and Lesters. We were thrown off from the beginning. People were smoking on the front porch when we got there and when we walked in we were greeted in the fashion you would expect from folks that were very disorganized. The atmosphere is ok for a family type country establishment but it is not a date night place-by any measure. All I thought of was "based on the looks of this place, the steak must be truly amazing" . We waited for 20 minutes and no one ever even acknowledged us. We finally asked someone if we had a server and she was kind enough to get someone to help us. Not going well so far but we were happy to finally have our drinks-which sat at the bar so long that we almost went up and just grabbed them ourselves. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and they were good and the sauce for the tomatoes was tasty. We were ready to order our dinner and the waitress came and explained to us that they were out of SEVERAL of the steaks-and I think they only had a total of 5 choices. They were out of porterhouse and they were out of another one-cant remember which one. I asked her which steak she recommended and she said the filet, which was my first choice-BUT then she told me that the filet was NOT part of the quality meat that they are supposedly known for. I asked her what that meant and she said "it is basically grocery store". So I kind of chuckled and ordered the rib eye.....I really did not know how to take that but it was kind of funny. My husband ordered the ribs. My steak came with a salad and it was truly the most pathetic little limp salad I have ever received-except for maybe the few times I had a salad at waffle house. Limp lettuce and served in a thin wood bowl, like you would purchase at The Dollar Store. I could not finish it. But we were there for the steak. We continued to sit and talk and noticed that they had a patio outside where music was playing and since our food was no where to be found-It had been 45 minutes since we ordered we went out the back door to see what the patio area was like. It is a cute little area and the band seemed like they were quite talented but I was shocked that they were serving food to people while groups of other people were sitting right on the patio area smoking. I am not that particular but it was pretty gross and the smell of cigarettes was very strong the second that back door opened. I really did not think this was allowed any longer by the Health Department but maybe it is. We went back inside and had simply had enough and asked the waitress where our food was. She was sweet and smiled and said she would check and by that time I explained to her that it had been a full hour. We waited another 10 minutes with no reply from her and then told her to get our check and we would not be staying any longer. She told the manager who came by and said very quietly "Sorry about that". That was it!!! And it was a very half-a-- apology. Basically I would not return if it was FREE. My time is more valuable then to spend it at an establishment that manages itself in this manner. On a side note-the waitresses congregate around the computer screen for ever. This establishment needs to move the computer screen to an area other than the middle of the restaurant so it is not so obvious that no one knows what they are doing. I felt strong enough about it to write this review in hopes that others do not waste their time or money.

They also run a lot of specials during football season. Great proximity to the movie theater, an excellent compliment to a movie for date night. Seriously, give this place a try. It is excellent.

resp.text:
Hi Choon,

I'm sorry you had a bad experience recently.  We try our best to give all of our customers a great experience, though we know we do make mistakes occasionally.  If you're open to it, we'd love to take care of you on your next visit.  If you will reply privately we can arrange something for you.  Email 360businessreviews@gmail.com with contact information or a name and we'll let you know what to do next.  Again, we apologize for the problems you experienced and we'll do our best to make it up to you.  Take care

text: 5 of my friends and I went to eat here October 17th. It was 35 minutes before we got our orders placed, several drunks were arguing at the bar LOUDLY, and that, sadly was not nearly the worst of it. After waiting for our food, now into an hour and a half, (We arrived at 8 :30 pm, our food hit our table after 10:30) we come to find our food had been dropped and was being "remade" When it hit our table, my friends Chip and Sara noticed their steaks were wrong, my shrimp was cold, and my buddy Seamus's burger was prepared incorrectly. After a few minutes, the meal went further south. Chip's steak had a distinct chemical taste to it, like it had been sprayed with oven cleaner. Sarah's had so much grit it was like they just picked it off the floor. Think that could be it? Nope. We began readying to leave at 11:30, only for Sarah and Chip to start puking, and me to have severe bowel discomfort. (I had one bite of her steak to test it, and I'm grateful for only that one.) They were sick until Sunday, vomiting and diarrhea. THIS was a $40 per plate place? THAT'S not even the end. Chip actually CALLED them to talk to the DM, and you know what the Manager told him? We shouldn't have complained about the time they were taking. REALLY GUY? NEVER EAT HERE. Go to Longhorn or somthing, because THESE morons might kill you.

text: Completely worth the one hour drive from Huntsville.  Unique salty taste with a hint of sweet and just the right amount of char.  Can't go wrong with the ribeye or the sirloin.  Loaded BBQ nachos could be a whole meal.    Brownie dessert is great.  Very very fair prices.   Probably doesn't charge enough so I will make it up with a monster tip!

name: Sandra Barrett-Hoomani
text: After having a 6oz steak and my company both having b-b-q sandwiches I would not feel compelles to make a return visit to Coach's in Tuscumbia.  I haven't tried their Hatton location.  The pulled pork of the b-b-q sandwiches didn't habe a very good smokey flavor ... it was only meat on a bun.  Flavorless.  The onion rings that were served with the sandwich tasted as though they had been cooked in old oil.  Not good.  My steak was cooked medium as I requested but was dry.   It, too, was flavorless needed a bit more seasoning plus butter would have helped.  The hushpuppies that I had along with the steak were ok.  The presentation of my meal was very unappealing...a steak, a piece of Texas toast, and hushpuppies rolling around.  No garnish or care of placement at  all.  The atmosphere If the original part of the building is great but the new area gelt as though we were in a low ceiling cave with very bad acoustics.  No, we won't be returning.

When  we ordered at the steak house the waitress told us they were out of sweet potatoes.( remember we were the first in the door) One of us wanted soup and salad and were told that they were out of soup as well.So stick to steak and eat a lot of salad because your not going to any bread to speak of either yeast rolls would have been so welcome.

text: Great food, service and atmosphere. The inside of the restaurant was clean and looked new. The shrimp bisque was too salty, but other than that everything we had here was delicious.

name: Thomas Gardner
text: My wife and I went out for our anniversary to southern chop. The service was impeccable and very pleasant. I ordered the NY strip and my wife ordered the pork chop, both cooked to perfection, I would recommend going hungry as the portions were very generous. At the end of our meal our waiter brought us a complimentary creme brûlée for our anniversary that was absolutely delicious. I can’t recommend this restaurant enough, and I will be back soon.

name: April Koeppel
text:
Was not very impressed. Hotel was great. Breakfast was good but the service was horrible until the end when another waiter started helping with our table. We had a table of 4 and 2 of us had food while the rest of us were still waiting for drinks. The original waitress threw a menu down in front of me and immediately asked if I knew what i wanted without even giving me a chance to look. It took forever to even get our drinks. We decided maybe it was because several people came in at the same time and tried to give it another chance for dinner. We ordered a starter, my husband order a steak and potato, and I just ordered a potato. They came out with just the potatoes. We waited about 20 minutes for the rest of the food which never came. We tried to get our waiters attention but he kept walking. My husband finally got another gentleman's attention for the check. He brought it promptly and we discovered that none of the other food had even been ordered. Would not recommend to anyone. I have been a server 10 years of my life and worked catering and fine dining events for 2 years. I am very understanding and pateint but this was outrageous. If I could give 0 stars, it has definitely earned it.

April Jackson

name: Jimmy Dunn
text: Amazing food and service. Wasn’t sure what to expect inside a hotel but was pleasantly surprised. Our steaks were as good (or better)  as any of the local upscale steakhouses.  We will definitely be back.

name: Kristen Kogerman
text: Food is decent,  staff is spectacular, ambience is ok...

name: Tiara Price
text: Brunch was to die for (very simple but great) and we were able to still order breakfast!!! It was 5 of us and we had the whole spot to ourselves. The waiter and hotel staff were great, might I add I had the bar mix me up a drink full of fall flavors and I believe that was the best drink I ever had, can't wait to go back.

name: Darrell Echols
text:
The overall dining experience was EXCEPTIONAL. The server, Rodney, was very knowledgeable and was able to answer every single question relating to the menu. The Sous Chef, Dom, visited our table and was very enthusiastic about cooking and it was evident on the plate. The ambiance is nice and relaxing. The Executive Chef Garien has done a great job keeping the menu "simple" yet elegant.
Hats off to the entire team and look forward to visiting again!!

name: Nancy Zeller
text: We stayed at the hotel attached. Bread brought out before the meal was a plate of cheesy cornbread muffins and dinner rolls. Both were cold and no plates were given. The cornbread muffins were very dry and the rolls were meh but tasted better when you didn't want to eat the food ordered. The NY strip (cost $32) came out rare instead of medium well. It was really fatty so I could only eat a little bit. The knife brought with the steak had dish detergent caked all over it. The brussel sprouts were delicious and I would recommend those. The caesar salad ($8) was small, tasted ok, and the croutons were an overly buttery, crunchless mess. A friend of ours ordered the filet mignon medium (cost $34) and it came out mooing with a giant frozen block of garlic butter on top. She said the parm fries were ok and a small portion.  Another friend ordered the Farmers Market mushroom spinach risotto (?$?) which was ok after she seasoned it. We did not have a reservation so we waited for 30 mins.  It took 2 hours for us to order, eat and pay once we sat at the table. I waited for an Apple Jack cocktail for 30 minutes so you can imagine how long everything else took.  Luckily, we still had a great time talking to each other but it would have been nice to have good food to enjoy with our friends.

text: Grrat food fun atmosphere

name: Jace Moo
text: Very interesting menu and wonderful cocktail specialties

My waitress Jackie was great kept my glass full and had a very positive attitude. I know this restaurant has had mixed reviews in the past, but this was my second positive experience eating while in town. I would definitely recommend giving this restaurant a try.

The salad bar was neglected with the dressing looking old and the salad was lettuce shred. One of the servers was throwing rugs around by the salad bar with a fan blowing the stirred dirt across the salad bar. Our server was good but we will not be returning to the stake pit especially after being asked to pay for our meal just after it was brought to the table.

Customers that came in after us got waited on before us. Waitress didn't pay attention to customers all the tables was dirty, salad bar was not clean, didn't get ask if we needed anything else. This was the worst experience. Bad atmosphere.

name: Jessica Szymczak
text: It was a Saturday evening. The restaurant has about 20 - 30 tables. Only 5 tables had patrons in them. After waiting 55 minutes for 2 steaks and 2 baked potatoes the waitress came to the table to notify us that they ran out of baked potatoes. Still after an hour of waiting still no food. The waitress said they only had 1 cook. Regardless there were only 9 people in the entire restaurant. After waiting over an hour we left without eating. The waitress was very kind but we will never go back and do not reccomend this restaurant to anyone.

It’s different from out back.

And was cooked good.
The prices were not bad.
Will I go back?   Yes
Thanks jim

The server, meal, etc., we're top notch and that's why I didn't hesitate to tip my waiter by 30%+. No more BAD service, and meals, from Longhorn's and Texas Road House. Big, big difference folks!👍👍👍Saltgrass Steakhouse👋👋👋

text: Our server was great and so was all of our food. Pricey but very good. We were there for lunch on a Tuesday. It was not crowded.

name: Timothy Brown
text: I give it 3 stars because the wait staff are very friendly. As for the food, it seems to be something that you have to have a taste for. I personally didn't like their seasoning combinations but that doesn't make it bad food.

name: Jon Hinds
text: My wife and I enjoyed a delicious ribeye and salmon. Is was perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. We will be back.

name: Anthony Turner
text: Ms. Aurora was the best. On of the most professional waitress I have had in a long time. The food is spectacular. This restaurant is worth every penny and more!!!

name: Shari Harbison
text: The food was awesome and the staff was very friendly. Our waitress was wonderful and checked on us regularly.

name: Joe Tgreat
text:
Six of for dinner on a Friday night as we had a mild 30 minute wait, it was a Friday night so no big deal. The fried mushrooms and jalapeno poppers were perfect.
Our server did a outstanding job of taking care of us and our food was delicious as well. Would I recommend this place?  Absolutely would.

name: Robert Heath
text:
Right off the bat, the place looked amazing. Like a steakhouse should. Rodeo posters from the 80s. Western displays everywhere. Well lit dining areas. All the staff were wearing masks properly.

Our server, Hunter, was amazing! She stopped by our table regularly to make sure we were still having a good time. She kept our drinks full. She even had a bit of small talk with us!

Overall a very good experience that I would gladly repeat!

name: Vanessa Brown
text: The New York Strip was delicious and cooked exactly like I requested. They serve large side portions so make sure to go hungry or prepared to take on leftovers. Our waiter was very nice and great with giving timely refills on drinks. I can't wait to go back!

name: Bridgett Fortenberry
text: I was taken to this place on  my 59 birthday on May 11, 2021 by my cousins. The food & service was absolutely WONDERFUL.  I would recommend this place to everyone.

name: John Wilson
text: My family went on this past Friday night which was busy understood. Our wait was 45 min to an hour. Ended up being longer, because the hostess did a poorly job.  They let a family with the same number come in and go in front of us and when I questioned it the hostess tried to justified  it and said you will be next.  She said oh they are selected members but didn't know their names and gave them our table.  I feel it was something else.

resp.text: Hi John. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Angela Fuller Grace
text: The Texas T-bone was seared and seasoned to perfection..loaded potatoes and broccoli in cheese sauce were the perfect sides. Truly, I enjoyed this meal.

name: Tina Kay
text: I go here specifically for fried mushrooms & fried shrimp.  The service is always wonderful & they don't mind bringing your to go orders outside to you when it's ready.  I never wait a long time.

name: Tiff Tiff
text: The food was delicious and our waitress was great!

name: LM W.
text: We ordered our food to go and it’s our first time eating here since the pandemic.  It was not the best.  The temperature of the food was room temperature including the soup.  The only thing that was absolutely delicious was the pie.  We use to frequent Saltgrass before Covid, I’m highly disappointed in our food this time.  Might not try again until I’m comfortable with actually dinning in.  We did however go back a few days later and order 3 cheesecakes to go.  They’re expensive but delicious.

resp.text: Hi LM W. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Danitra Manigault
text:
My family and I came to Alabama for the weekend and tried this place because it was near the hotel we were staying at. The parking lot was full so we were sure that this place was going to be awesome. Well it wasn't. the food was just terrible. The rib meat did fall come off the bone but it was soooooo dry and unseasoned. My daughter had a cheeseburger that was ok. My mother in law tried the salmon and herb rice. The salmon actually was good, but the rice was mushy. I ate the loaded potato soup. That wasn't bad. I liked the potato soup but that's all I ate. I don't know what batter the used for the shrimp because that was not good.

The server we had was VERY nice and pleasant. She did give suggestions on what to try, but our palates didn't agree.

name: m chadwick
text: Wow great new place for an expansive nice family steakhouse. The prices are a little more. I will say worth it!! Servers are friendly and efficient. The food is great and not skimpy plates. You will leave full and happy..I am sure. We had a great variety at our table. The appetizers were Rattlers. These things are giant jalapeños with shrimp and cheese battered and fried. When you dip in ranch wonderful!!!! The desserts were pecan bread pudding yum!## There was carrot cake such nice size peices. Also cheese cake. Hoover location is close to the Galleria Mall.

name: Rod Johnson
text: What a great meal! Order the Maudeen’s Center-Cut Filet medium well with loaded baked potato and asparagus. Steak was seasoned well, asparagus was good too ,so was the mashed potatoes. Order gripe would be the food was not hot. You can tell that food had been sitting before pickup and brought out to me.

text: I went to the location in hoover instead of 280, and I was very disappointed.  I ordered a potato soup and the waitress brought it out and it looked thick like mashed potatoes.  I took a chance and bit into it. It was ice cold. It was so disturbing I called out to any waitress to help!  The waitress who helped me was really nice. I'm so glad because I didn't see my waitress for awhile. That's why I have this two stars otherwise it would have been 1 star. The steak was ok and the macaroni was ok. The chef just slappedsome cold soup in a bowl and have it to me. They should do better.

name: Cj Welborn
text: Went there on a whim because we were in the area and it wasn't crowded. We got way more than we paid for. Great atmosphere, great servers, and the food was awesome. We had the steak and shrimp, which was cooked perfectly, and then the pecan bread as a dessert. I didn't even know what it was, but I'm glad we tried it. I will definitely be going back.

name: Donna Chancey
text:
The food is just fanTastic! We had aMazing service, 4 people taking care of 3 of us, and one was the Manager! Recommend:
Rattlesnake Rattlers for appetizer, Carrot Cake for dessert! On-site Baker, Y'all!

name: Donnie Turner
text: What a great Steak House!!! Excellent steak,  the rice was very very good. I love blue cheese dressing but the ranch was better. Medium price range,  won't break the bank on a couple date.

name: Amber Terry
text: Saltgrass never disappoints! ❤

name: Mickey Berry
text: We visited here for our office Christmas party and again last night. Our food was top-notch and the service was professional and prompt.  The steak compares well with higher-priced local chains and at about 1/2 the price. I like the atmosphere and the way the management is involved with your experience.

name: Elizabeth Douglas
text: I went for a business dinner and found the food to be decent, but not what I was expecting from a dedicated steakhouse. My steak and shrimp were flavorful but they and the mashed potatoes were barely warm. The bread was good. The atmosphere was a bit cramped, but we did have a large party. I will say our waiter was excellent and very nice - no complaints about the staff whatsoever. I would give it another try, to see if my experience differed from my initial impression. If so, I would definitely adjust my review accordingly.

name: Nicole Haynes
text: I went in and the girl said 45 minutes and took my phone number an hour later I went in to see when we would be seated only to be told I cancelled. Now let me see how was I suppose to do that. I was informed that I got a text when I gave her my number and I cancelled then. Whelp let me just say I have never gotten a text but I was seated only to have a waitress that was working her third double and didn't know where she was, but I can't say that just about her. We sat and watched staff come from the kitchen wnd try to find the right table food went to. We watched peoples order just get left off and just not right at all. All this for just ok food. Not again

name: Jolene Douglas
text: This is my first ever bad review- Don’t bother making a reservation. The establishment states that they will seat you before walk ins, but in our situation no table was available at the reserved time (we did arrive 5 minutes prior). I called 15 minutes before they closed (45 minutes after our reserved time), and was offered a table by a manager, but was told there would still be a wait by the host. As a former restaurant host, I know the staff dread of taking a last minute before close table- that is the mark of a rude inconsiderate customer.  We may have dodge bad food according to other reviews. I should have waited until they closed to see if they’d bother paging us or letting us know they were closing and could not serve us.

resp.text: Hi Jolene. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: cathy stanley
text: Steak was amazing! Worth every penny.

name: Stacey Wade
text: On March 16th, 2021 around 2:30ish me and my mom stopped to have lunch here we have ate here previously several times and the food was good . I ordered a baked potato. macaroni and a salad * I don't eat meat* my mom ordered the baby back rib plate . The waitress came out and said they was out of ribs so my mom ordered the chicken without the gravy with a baked potato. Both baked potatoes cold, macaroni cold, chicken tasted burnt and the bread we waited on forever didn't get it until after our meal arrived was cold although she said it was right out of the oven! We ask for the manager he did come to the table to ask could he make it over but we had somewhere else to be so really didn't have time for him to remake what we already waited on, he did take them items off the ticket but made us pay for a salad I didn't eat and a sweet tea I didn't drink . The worst part is they was not even busy!!  Maybe us and 3 more tables Bad service and Food was cold.  Never Again! Very disappointed this time !

text: I was very pleased!! This was my first time eating here and I must say everything was delicious 😋. I can see myself eating at this establishment again!

text: I went with a group.  My cheeseburger was very sad.  It was very overcooked and the tomato was hard and white. With two beers and a tip on the bill it only cost us $127. 00.  The waiter was nice enough.  It was just sad that the food wasn't good.

name: Bonk
text:
res·er·va·tion
/ˌrezərˈvāSH(ə)n/
noun
1.
the action of reserving something.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: This restaurant is like your upscale steakhouse. The menu is normal, but the prices are outrageous. The atmosphere was good, but the restaurant stays crowded and causes a lot of traffic. The food was okay and no special garnishment or appearance than your regular steak house. Actually Logan's has a b ettet appearance in plating the food. I ordered a mesquite grilled chicken breast, garlic mashed potatoes and a salad. The chicken was a normal size and had the grill marks on the chicken. The garlic potatoes were prepared the regular way. The salad was good, however they add the dressing to it. It would be best to have the customer apply the dressing so they can gauge it to their taste. I attended for a birthday dinner and the waitresses were really good and polite. I enjoyed the fellowship, but the food was nothing special. I think I will stick with Logan's.

text: Awsome my favorite  place love the atmosphere

name: Kari Osborne
text:
Overall, everyone's food was good, and we certainly appreciated the effort the restaurant put forth to ensure a safe distance between tables. Based on the food, we would go back again.  The reason for the rating is specific to the following:

While the restaurant had a notice posted to the door requiring patrons wear a face mask while inside the building until they reached their table (in compliance with local ordinances), the host really showed no authority in enforcing that policy.  Specifically, a couple sat down in the waiting area and refused to wear the mask they had in their hands or even distance themselves from others not in their party.  Unfortunately, the host did not attempt to reinforce their policy or even get someone that could.

Regardless of any actual benefit of wearing a mask, the lack of discretion in enforcing the ordinances they are bound to uphold in order to reopen is concerning.

The bread wasn’t anything fancy and their sweet butter was okay too.

text: I showed up starving. They were so busy. I parked in a takeout spot and dialed the number. I'd never seen the menu. I told the gal my steak wishes and my budget. I hardly knew I'd hung up the phone before a masked and friendly gal handed me a sack at my car. Sure. You can take and fill orders all day. The steak? Like butter. Where you snap fingers and wave in the chef for kudos, because your mouth is too full to talk, then you remember you're not a mob boss, and that you just got Saltgrass steak, carryout.

name: Haynes Mobile Notary & Wedding Services LLC
text: I took my 6 yr old grand daughter to Saltgrass 12/28/19.  The wait for a table wasn't too long.  The food was average and the service wasn't too bad either.  My server was nice and he tried his best but.... he never brought our salad.  The ribs were not fall off the bone tender.  The chips for my spinach dip were a little too done for my taste.  The server said they would comp those because he said they had not changed the grease the chips were friend in but they never did.  Instead they came back and told me there was nothing wrong with the chips.  They said the chips were dark because the chips were corn chips and not flour chips.  I ordered steak fries and instead I was given diced potatoes and they too were dark as though they were cooked in "Old oil".  The server was supposed to bring us to go cups and never did.  I called back once I got home to speak to the manager (as they were very busy while I was there and I didn't want to cause anyone else to have the issues I had) I spoke to the manager and all she offered me was a free salad the next time I come in.  I asked her if I get a side salad with my meal why would I want 2 salads... She then offered me a free salad if I should be coming through town and wanted to stop in and pick it up.  Chances are great I will not be back to Saltgrass.  I paid over $50 plus a tip for a meal for a 6 year old and myself and I received a comedy of errors and average food and all I was offered was a free side salad with my next meal (that comes with a side salad).

text:
My husband and I went for our anniversary on Saturday night. The wait was only about 15 minutes, despite them not accepting reservations. The food was excellent, cooked exactly how we ordered it. The bread was tasty and not burnt tasting like other steak houses.

We ordered the Queso Fresco with braised brisket and it was delicious! I ordered Maudeen's Center Cut Filet with loaded garlic mashed potatoes and it was one of the best steaks I've had. Anouska was a great server. She catered to our needs even to the point of adjusting our plates/appetizers to ensure we had ample room on our table.

I highly recommend it. We have a new favorite restaurant!

My advice be careful with shrimp cocktail made me sick for some reason (I don't have food allergies) I eat shrimp all the Time. But great place to eat tho

name: Lauren Crandall
text:
This place truely does not live up to the hype. We waited an hour and a half for a table. It was nice that they did texting so we were able to go across to shop and walk around while we waited.
We ordered the loaded fries, which were not fries. They are potato bites, which was fine and they were really good! My companion and I both ordered steak and shrimp items and were both very dissatisfied. The steaks were COVERED in pepper. You couldn't even enjoy the flavor of the steak through the pepper, mine was also over cooked. My shrimp was good though so that was a plus. The Mac and cheese was flavorless though.
The service was sub par. You could tell the servers were swamped and ours literally ran away from our table when she took our drink orders. I don't blame her at all since I know how hard it is to manage a large section. Every interaction with her was super short and cut off by her walking away. When she came to check on our food after we got it she barely stopped. I didn't even bother to tell her we didn't like it because we had already waited over 2 hours for the table then food.
All in all we may go back in a few months, but it wasn't anything special. After seeing all the hype about it I was very let down.

Service was very good and everyone enjoyed their meals.  I am pleased we have another good restaurant choice in our area.  I will defiantly be back for more.

text: I don’t usually give 5 stars, but I don’t think I’ve ever been more impressed with a steakhouse as I was tonight at Saltgrass Steakhouse. From the moment they opened the door for my family it was a 5 star experience. We were seated quickly and the waitress, Kelly, was awesome! She was very knowledgeable of the menu as this was our first time dining there so we asked a few questions before ordering. She timed our food just right so that we were never left waiting on the next course. The food was excellent! In fact, I told my husband that it was quite possibly the best flavored steak I’d ever had. To top off the excellent evening, they held the door open for us on the way out! We will definitely be eating here again!

Then after one hour they finally let us know that they could seat us at 2 different tables across the restaurant. We finally decided to leave after that. Terrible service. Would only recommend this place to people I want to suffer.

text: I had a get time today.  My sister and myself enjoyed a 12 oz.tee bone steak.  It was cooked just right.  Atmosphere was great.  You can go dressed or casual.  We were casual. Food server was very attentive.

name: Anna Hart
text: I’m not sure how I can give one star to our experience today but the system doesn’t allow for a zero star rating.  It did smell nice in the waiting area but that is as far as we got.  We gave our names to the host requesting a table of 6 and were told that it would be a 25 minute wait at 12:15.  The app said that we were the next table at the 12:45 minute mark.  At 1:05, we were still sitting at the entrance watching the host sending consecutive snapchats from his phone.  My husband complained to an employee who quickly explained to him that seating wasn’t her job.  I think he might have been talking loud enough that someone alerted another employee who came to talk to us but did not introduce herself.  She informed us that she was unable to seat a table of six due to Covid19 restrictions but could seat 5 of us at one table and 2 of us at another across the restaurant from each other. Considering that it was Fathers Day, we didn’t feel that was a feasible option for our family so we left.  We were offered no other option.  She never apologized or Indicated that she felt bad that we had waited almost an hour and could not sit together.   As we walked out, she sarcastically said, “Have a nice dinner”.  We ate fast food for Father’s Day this year at 2:00 pm.  Thank you, saltgrass, for teaching my kids what customer service should never look like.

name: Blake Bohne
text: Food was absolutely delicious and only reason I gave it 2 stars. Service was horrible. We had to ask for pretty much everything, silverware, salt/pepper. Dinner came so fast I put my salad to the side to eat later. Bar tender took it without even asking if I was done with it. Drink I ordered, she apparently could not make and it tasted like she didn't. Would have been happy to order an easier drink if she would have said something. For a moderately priced restaurant the level of service was unacceptable. I would not go back. But I would be willing to try the one on 280 because the meal was so good. At least what I was allowed to eat.

text: Our first trip there. Definitely a place we will go back to. Server was attentive, was able to answer all of our questions, and friendly. The steaks were very tender and flavorful. Sign of a good steak is not needing steak sauce. We were offered some, but didn't need it.

text: Only 5 stars because I can't give more!! First bite of my Ribeye and my first thoughts....OH MY GAWD! OUTBACK WHO?? I am from Virginia and LOVE a great steak. Well by God, Saltgrass IS the best steak!! Broccoli was superb! Grille shrimp!! Oh my!! Huge, juicy, as was my ribeye and delicious!! I sure hope people read these reviews!! I'm not in town my longer and I have to try Saltgrass again!!

My husband’s steak which was ordered medium was well done and dry as a bone.  I ordered the brisket burger which was also very dry, seemed like it might have been cooked earlier and rewarmed.  My side was a baked potato which was not fully cooked, hard and lumpy in spots.  The waitress was nice and attentive but the food was bad and very overpriced.  We love Landry’s but we will not go back to Saltgrass.
