text: Very Good

name: Vicky Whitaker
text: Only 5 stars because I can't give more!! First bite of my Ribeye and my first thoughts....OH MY GAWD! OUTBACK WHO?? I am from Virginia and LOVE a great steak. Well by God, Saltgrass IS the best steak!! Broccoli was superb! Grille shrimp!! Oh my!! Huge, juicy, as was my ribeye and delicious!! I sure hope people read these reviews!! I'm not in town my longer and I have to try Saltgrass again!!

name: Jason Coscia
text: Jordon W is a delight! Not only is he handsome, he’s polite, knowledgeable and crafty with those cocktails. I’ll be there to eat and drink because of him!  This guy deserves a raise!!

name: Katie Love
text: It was cooked perfect and oh so yummy.. service was excellent too.

name: Lindsey Ann Collins
text: We went on a Sunday night. They weren’t very busy and basically everything went wrong. First; our appetizer was wrong. The butter dish for the bread was disgusting. There was black stuff all in the bottom. 🤢 Six entrees were ordered; four of the six entrees were wrong. Meat was cooked wrong, sides were incorrect, etc. One entree was wrong three times. Two managers came out and apologized for the food taking so long. Instead of offering a solution, they asked us what they could do to fix it... Ultimately they took $20 off the bill. It was a terrible experience. I don’t recommend it.

name: KENNETH CROOM
text: Just visited this place for the first time. I wanted to get out for a nice meal while I had some free time. Just me, so I sat at the bar directly in front of the kitchen. A cook brings my food out, gives it to my server, then starts to remove some type of debris from the plate. Looks to be some paper or a receipt. He shakes it carefully, apparently making sure the liquid gets off of there and back onto my food. The server, about 5 feet away and in my direct line of sight, brings it to me. I asked what it was that had been removed from the plate and she initially denies that anything was taken off of it. I remind her that I was looking directly at them the entire time. Then she says that there was something on the plate but not touching the food. Then, I remind her that it was dripping wet and had to touch the food or have been touching something else before it landed on my plate. She asks bluntly if I want it and looks confused as to why I did not. Other bartender reorders my food and manager apologizes, but my experience is still ruined. Completely insulting.

name: Glenda Liggon
text: Very Good

name: Adam Taylor
text: This is third time here and most likely last.  The host sat us in a noisy party area and it was just 2 of us.  The waitress had a little attitude.  It took forever to get food and we arrived before 5 pm.  I ordered a medium well sirloin that came out well done.  My mom got a chopped steak well done that came out black.  She was not able to eat it.  Manager did ask if she wanted another one; however, by time waitress finally came back to table to check on us, I was already done.  They did credit the meal for my mom, but they charged her for a salad.  The entire meal should have been FREE with the horrible service and the food not prepared as requested.  Save your time and money because there are much cheaper steak places around Birmingham with good service and food.

name: Lindsey Ann Collins
text: We went on a Sunday night. They weren’t very busy and basically everything went wrong. First; our appetizer was wrong. The butter dish for the bread was disgusting. There was black stuff all in the bottom. 🤢 Six entrees were ordered; four of the six entrees were wrong. Meat was cooked wrong, sides were incorrect, etc. One entree was wrong three times. Two managers came out and apologized for the food taking so long. Instead of offering a solution, they asked us what they could do to fix it... Ultimately they took $20 off the bill. It was a terrible experience. I don’t recommend it.

name: Jerusalemplayroom Murrell
text: First time eating our waitress Eboni was very professional. Food was hot. I ordered the chopped steak and potatoes. The lowest price on the menu was about $10.00 for appetizers everything else about $14.00 and up. Great experience and I will go again. 😁

name: Francis Perdue
text: The food and deink selection was awesome

name: Gail Sparks
text: Never a bad meal. Every time we visit, the food is amazing and the staff treats us like family. We've not been near a Saltgrass for 8 years and when we moved here and found one, it was like nothing had changed!

name: Earnest Jemison
text: Ben was a great server and the food was excellent.

name: Anthony Madrid
text: Stopped in for lunch.  The food was awesome. The staff was friendly. Tony our waitress was great and made our special order cocktail perfectly!  The grilled shrimp was delicious.

name: joshua fedor
text: Amazing food and great staff. Alex was super knowledgeable about the menu and actually carried engaged conversations with all the people at the bar. You could really tell she was not just going through the motions and cared. The staff ran very well and the managers were helping the staff, which is very nice to see. Great atmosphere. I'm happy Hoover has a nice steak house finally.

name: Chris Plowman
text: I had a great overall experience. Waiter was friendly and helped with questions about the menu. Steak was cooked the way I liked it and was tender and juicy. French fries were cooked to perfection, and salad was fresh and cold. I enjoyed every second. Highly recommend to anyone.

name: Kawitta Johnson
text: Good food

name: Candice Wilkerson
text: Steaks are the best

name: Richard Roddy
text: Great service and food was great!

name: James Kennedy
text: The food is phenomenal when Alex is working! She is truly an asset to your establishment and the only reason.I come back even after having bad or mediocre service from someone else! If I’m in the mood for Saltgrass and I have a feeling Alex is present I know that without a doubt it will be a great experience! Never Disappointed when Alex provides, Go See her behind the bar and know that she will do everything she can to ensure a superior experience!

name: Bena T
text: Girlfriend and I had dinner there today.  I had been before but she hadn't.  My previous visit experienced good food but bad service.  This time, everything was great!!!  Food was outstanding and service (Jennifer) was perfect.  Learned later that manager had changed since my previous visit.  Recommend wholeheartedly!!

name: Donna Brame
text: Like the Hoover one better.

name: Cameron holifield
text: Food was great waiter sucked would recommend

name: john owens
text: The bread pudding with pecans and ice cream was the best bread pudding that I ever ate. I have had about 10 different ones.this is the best.

name: Joseph Gumeny
text: Looked nice but they close at 9:30!!! At 9:15 not enough time to read a menu and be served. Applebees next door open until 12. But they are really crowded.

name: Jacki Collins
text: My husband and I went to visit Salt Grass for the First time 8/24/2018 and we were in the midst of finishing our meal. The food was good but we notice that there were Cockroaches crawling under the table from us. One started to fly towards our way and my husband had no other choice but to step on it. Another one came out of nowhere and the waiter asked if she can use our napkin after she stepped on it and pick it up with our napkin. I felt that was so unprofessional and  disgusting . Informed my waiter Of the situation and there response was oh there’s nothing we can do your food is gone now.  The manger came over to apologize but this will be our first and  last time coming!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Summer Turner
text: Well worth the wait! Ebony,our waitress, was amazing. The southwest steak and shrimp was great. Overall just a wonderful experience. Thanks guys!!

name: Linda Norris
text: First time visitors.  Family BIRTHDAY celebration.  We had an awesome time. Food was awesome. Service was awesome. Servers were awesome. Was there2 days later. Again, Awesome. My BIRTHDAY is in May,  will surely celebrate there!

name: Treava M
text: Food pretty good. Service was great! Celebrated a family birthday there! And...its not freezing!

name: Yeaz 031
text: Really enjoyed the New York Strip, ribeye a little thin. Excellent shrimp, sides and great service!

name: John Samuel Gurtler
text: Seemed understaffed. Took forever to get a medium steak. Then when it arrived, it was going  cold. I wonder how long it sat in the kitchen before it sat in front of me.

name: Rachel VtoBe
text: Server wasn’t great . There was us and one other group of 4 when we got there.  And the server was MIA. Took forever to get refills.  Finally got meal and my  side was cold . I asked If I could get my side warm. They literally brought another side on a hot plate but it wasn’t warm.  I gave 3 stars because they had gluten free options and that’s hard to come by with someone who cannot have gluten. It was our first experience and we weren’t pleased.

name: triplejay
text: Love the food

name: Brittany Biddie
text: I love this place! We go almost every sunday. We always ask for Ben and he always does a great job!!! I always get the center cut oscar style medium rare and they are one of the few places I have been that does not over cook my steak!

name: Daniel Young
text: Went here for my a special occasion.  First off and it could have happened but we didn't get a text or call while waiting. Once we got in the hostess stated they had a table ready and we still waited another 15 minutes. Waiter was forgetful. We waited almost 15 minutes for water and mango tea. Got the bread it was cold and hard. And to top it off my wife had a longggggg piece of hair in her salad. I eat at salt grass in Texas quite often.  But here it was garbage.  I'll never recommend or go back.

name: crystal davenport
text: Great food and drinks . Monday and Tuesdays are kind of slow if you're interested in going when it's not so crowded

name: Ryan Trammell
text: Love love love

name: L Rená
text: I had no idea what to expect the first time I visited! I ordered the steak and brussels. Wow!!! Cooked just the way I ordered, and I'm so sad to hear they're discontinuing the Brussels sprouts side! The food was worth the price, and the servers are AWESOME!

name: Tracy West s
text: One of the best steaks I've ever had in my life. I know good customer service and this place is wonderful! Candice was our server and she is great.

name: Brooke Leeth Jenkins
text: Staff was talking to each other and we had to go find them to get service...

name: Eric Lewis
text: Took the wife for her birthday. My steak that u asked to be medium was well done. The wife whe asked  for medium well was medium rare aje sent hers back. We ate at another location a year back and quite frankly expected better

name: Lynn Gates
text:
Service was horrible! We waited while people who came in after us was being served their food! I complained to management who must have told our waitress because she came out and scolded us for complaining. Said all the soup spoons were dirty and that no one was in the back to serve her the soup. We asked for the manager again who wanted to try and make it all right but we just left.
The one on 280 is just as bad. Go to Texas Roadhouse instead!!!! Cheaper and we have never had a bad meal or service.

name: Juanvinetta Elliott
text: Too crowded

name: Aimee McConnell
text: Usually great. Today food was not hot and felt like it had been sitting a while. Also, suddenly baked potatoes are an upcharge....

name: Precious Lewis
text: Went to this location first and ended up leaving. A friend and I were seated at an 8 person table. The table and chairs had not been cleaned and had crumbs on them. There also was a leak from the ceiling in a section of the waiting area. Hwy 280 location was much better.

name: Amanda Bullard Carden
text: I went here for lunch a few days ago to try something different. I was very pleasantly surprised! Everything from the food to the atmosphere, to the wait staff was awesome.  I ordered from the lunch menu, but the portions were easily dinner sized or more. My only hold up is that it was a bit expensive, for lunch anyhow. I definitely feel as though I got my money's worth. I will be back soon!

name: Martin Homer
text: The service was decent. Missed a few details with the order. Food was good but pricey for the quality. Best thing was the fried mushrooms

name: Ben Jones
text: Worst service I’ve had in a long time. Stood at hostess table for over 5 minutes with no one to help. When hostess finally came up, she was incredibly rude.

resp.text: Hi Ben. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Huny Marie
text: We called in advance to reserved tables for 20 people at 2pm to celebrate graduation. We were told this could be accommodated without problem. We arrived at 1:45 and by 2pm 13 of our party had arrived. We waited until 2:45 to be seated and were told three different stories in that timeframe. Sat at two tables, one of our tables ordered, ate, and boxed their food before our table got our salads/soups. We sat for 2hrs waiting on food to the point where we didn’t want it anymore. There was no compensation offered and management seemed more annoyed to apologize than forth coming. I will never visit or  recommend this establishment again. WORST 3hrs ever!!!

name: Don Miles
text: Steak was good, but it was $21.75 plus tax for 3 22-ounce Miller Lite drafts. That's a little over $24 for what amounts to a pitcher of beer.

name: Alicia Kenerley
text: I thoroughly enjoyed everything. We had a very professional, attentive waitress named Haley. I had their Chicken Laredo. Even though it would never have occurred to me to put diced avocado on top of grilled chicken, the other elements they combined with it made the dish really, really fantastic! Sorry, no photos.

name: Sharon Williams
text: Food was delicious and the servants was excellent

name: Jacob Boyles
text: Not sure of the typical standards for "Saltgrass" considering this was my first time; This Restuarant was outstanding! The Service was absolutely phenomenal. The food was some of the best I've had in a while. The manager made it a point to check in on me and was a friendly conversationalist. I'd recomend this place a hundred times over for any occasion!

name: Richard Elliott
text: Hands down the best place to eat. Friendly and courteous staff, awesome just awesome.

name: Debra Hawk
text: Food was Top notch, service was excellent.

name: Joshua Pickett
text: I definitely recommend this place. Food was great and timed perfectly. The service was overwhelming (in a good way). It was like I had several servers, a couple of managers, and maybe even a cook help make sure I was taken care of. Maybe it was because they had just opened and they had an experienced crew from another location? Either way, I was treated very well.

name: Joshua Pickett
text: I definitely recommend this place. Food was great and timed perfectly. The service was overwhelming (in a good way). It was like I had several servers, a couple of managers, and maybe even a cook help make sure I was taken care of. Maybe it was because they had just opened and they had an experienced crew from another location? Either way, I was treated very well.

name: Huny Marie
text: We called in advance to reserved tables for 20 people at 2pm to celebrate graduation. We were told this could be accommodated without problem. We arrived at 1:45 and by 2pm 13 of our party had arrived. We waited until 2:45 to be seated and were told three different stories in that timeframe. Sat at two tables, one of our tables ordered, ate, and boxed their food before our table got our salads/soups. We sat for 2hrs waiting on food to the point where we didn’t want it anymore. There was no compensation offered and management seemed more annoyed to apologize than forth coming. I will never visit or  recommend this establishment again. WORST 3hrs ever!!!

name: Ken
text: Food was great. Service was really great. The girls working the bar were super friendly. If you want a good steak I highly recommend eating here. Bring your wallet, but it's worth it!

name: Jacob Boyles
text: Not sure of the typical standards for "Saltgrass" considering this was my first time; This Restuarant was outstanding! The Service was absolutely phenomenal. The food was some of the best I've had in a while. The manager made it a point to check in on me and was a friendly conversationalist. I'd recomend this place a hundred times over for any occasion!

name: Kewanee Fox
text: Food was good. Service seemed to be a little slow. However, when I tell you that customer service was on point, it made the wait a little easier. I had the Brisket Burger. It was a lot of meat but it was good. If I could make one suggestion though, we were a family of 6 at a very small table. By the time appetizers,  drinks and food came out, there was no room for eating. So please consider elbow room when seating customers.

name: M Ranieri
text: Great! The steak melted in my mouth. I like it rare and it was perfect!  Comes with a salad and side.  Very reasonably priced.  The salad was great - all fresh.  Dessert - the brownie/cookie/ice cream dessert is absolutely divine.  Out of this world - but share - it is huge and the calorie count is scary!  But it is totally worth it!

name: Ben Jones
text: Worst service I’ve had in a long time. Stood at hostess table for over 5 minutes with no one to help. When hostess finally came up, she was incredibly rude.

resp.text: Hi Ben. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Joshua Lee
text: My girl friend and I stopped by because we wanted to try something new. We were blown away with the quality and professionalism of the staff. From the time we sat down to when we were greeted by our server. Our meal was prompt and delicious. It was however over cooked. They replaced our meal and apologized for it. The second meal was the perfect steak. It was a wonderful experience.

name: Bill Tiemann
text: This was my first visit to Saltgrass Steak House. First of all this seems to be a very popular restaraunt. Luckily I arrived a few minutes before 5:00 pm and was seated immediately. However, by the time I left there was quite a few people waiting for tables. The food was excellent. My steak was cooked exactly the way I wanted it. I like it medium rare and it was perfect. The sides, a house salad and a baked potato were top notch as well. Our server was prompt attentive and friendly without being overbearing. I thought the prices were about where they should be considering the quality of food, service and atmosphere. I highly recommend Saltgrass Steak House.

name: Holly Fancher
text: Steak was perfectly cooked!! Shrimp was tasty as well as the bread served as an appetizer. We will definitely be returning.

name: Kewanee Fox
text: Food was good. Service seemed to be a little slow. However, when I tell you that customer service was on point, it made the wait a little easier. I had the Brisket Burger. It was a lot of meat but it was good. If I could make one suggestion though, we were a family of 6 at a very small table. By the time appetizers,  drinks and food came out, there was no room for eating. So please consider elbow room when seating customers.

name: olivia wonderful
text: We just happen to go at the right time since they are normally busy. I ordered fried shrimp which was perfect and my hubby ordered a steak cooked well. The steak was burnt on one side therefore they could use a lesson in  cooking a steak well without burning it. Everything else was good.

name: Frank Simersky
text: Great little rib eye steak and fried shrimp

name: Roderick Holmes
text: Great steaks!

name: Joycelyn Nixon
text: Service was good, cocktails good, appetizer good, main entree not so good. Only been to 1 oyher Saltgrass in Texas and the food was so amazing was hoping for the same here. Grilled marinated chicken was so dry it was hard yo eat. Others in the group similar experience. Main dish ok sides not so much.

name: Kimberly Harmon Miss Kim as Aretha
text: I love this restaurant. I've been to the Hoover location and now the 280 location and both of them we're awesome. No denying they are onto something. Quality food good service.

name: Brian Friedman
text: If you like waiting 45 minutes for a cold overcooked thin little ribeye then waiting another 45 minutes for it’s corrected replacement only to be told you can’t take it to go for some unknown reason then this is your dream restaurant. If that’s not you go somewhere else.

name: Josh Markham
text: Never got seated. Was given an unrealistic timeframe for the wait. Was told 30-40 minutes. After 45 minutes I asked and they said it may be another 30. They were still telling people 30 minutes.

name: iliana sheetz
text: our food was amazing, our server was amazing. we only give 4 stars because our food took 45 mins to come out and my wife ended up not eating her lunch, which was her lunch hour from work. they never offered to take it off or a discount or anything. we have worked in the service industry for over 15 years. so we know how it should work... other than that the place was amazing...

name: Sp3tsnaz - CODM
text: Great experience, vaqueros tacos were delicious! Steak fries could have used some more flavor, so I just got sriracha mayo on the side. Our party finished eating and paid the bill in about an hour and a half; however, we stayed and chatted for about another 1-1.5 hours. While our drinks were never refilled, we did not feel as if the staff was pressuring us to leave, which would have definitely bothered me more. Definitely recommend if you'd like some tasty food at a great price!

name: Taylor Sherer
text: Great steak but a little pricey, great service though! Will be back when I have a good payday!

name: James Graves
text: the waters were nice humble and decent, they did not mess up my order , food was good and filling  I definitely would recommend visiting☑☑☑

name: Antonio Smith
text: Surprisingly good fried shrimp. Love the Surf and Turf meal.

name: Delana Spencer
text: The food is good. The service was friendly and professional.  The only thing our server Vincent was nice and knowledgeable but a little anxious. He would reach for your plate while asking if you're through eating. I almost had block his hand because he might have grabbed my plate before I  could say no. I will go back again the overall experience was very good .

name: Kesh Renee
text: I have heard my co-workers talk about how good the eats are here but when I went it was amazing!!! A+ for Customer Service, A+ for Waitress Knowledge, A+ for Food, A+ for Quality,  and A+ to the lady that hand wraps the silverware!!! The Salmon Oscar was Deliciously good!!! Seasonings were spot with the whole dish and I am convinced that the WHOLE menu is awesome! I have definitely added Saltgrass to my top 3 best places to eat...

name: Holly Fancher
text: Steak was perfectly cooked!! Shrimp was tasty as well as the bread served as an appetizer. We will definitely be returning.

name: Chance Wheeler
text: Service great at first, server changed and cups were empty for awhile before asked if we wanted more. Food was better than I have had in a long time. Steak was perfect.

name: Perin Hankins
text: Good service and great food.😊

name: John King
text: Really good place for steak. Lunch here was great with excellent service.

name: Stan Dickinson
text: Oustanding.... Shrimp Cocktail... is a must!

name: Jeremy Busby
text: This place beats Firebirds and J. Alexander's. You're not getting a Waffle House steak, it actually has flavor of a wood fired grilled as opposed to those places that advertise that exclusively. The waitress knew the menu as if it was second nature and did not miss a beat with any questions. Prices are reasonable for the quality and service.

name: Kelly Bell - Gaddy
text: This was my first time here. I was in town for business. I had the 6oz. center cut filet at medium temperature and macaroni and cheese. The side salad was fresh. The steak was cooked to perfection. Didn't even has to use A1. The macaroni and cheese was tasty as well. Great service by Princess. Prompt table clearing. I couldn't ask for a better experience. I will be back next time I'm in town.

name: Rip from Cecil
text:
Got there around 7 on Sunday evening.
Its sort of cold and rainy outside so a quick soup and salad sounds great. The waitress Jennifer was a star. She suggested the chicken tortilla soup for us both and I had the hill country salad.
The food and the service are 4 stars so I will be back.

name: patrick thomas
text: Friendly staff..reasonably priced..good service  and good food

name: Easter The Egg
text: I had 2 other stellar visits here but tonight was horrible. I was served 2 over cooked steaks and when the manager was called, he told me it was "as close as it can be" to medium rare when I definitely have had it cooked perfectly twice before. I tried to suck it up and eat the second overcooked steak only to find out that it was so salty. Horrible experience

name: Carnischa Calvin
text: Service was mediocre. We order our food and everything came at the same time (soup, salad, and main dish). Disappointment. I could not enjoy my soup because I didn’t  want my streak to get cold. Oh yeah we got our bread last. Like very last we were finished eating LAST.  My friend steak had more fat on it then meat. My streak was okay tho. They were tad bit heavy handed with the season on it. Just a tad. Would I go back? Nope I’ll pick Logan or Texas Roadhouse over this. Honestly

name: Rhonda Smith
text: Good food, great service, decent porpotions & pricey. 3 meals, 1 app, 1 water, 2 teas & 1/2 rack of ribs. $93.xx with tax.

name: Karen Borden
text: Tonight I decided to take myself out on a date to a nice restaurant. Everything from the service to the food and wine to the ambiance was fantastic! I even purchased a rewards card for future visits. Is officially one of my favorite restaurants in Birmingham!

name: Crystal Mabe
text:
Went on a Friday night around 8pm. The restaurant was very busy,our waitress only had 2 tables she was serving. She took a order for 3 meals at our table. Nothing complicated or add ons, just steaks and our choice of 2 sides. After 30 minutes of waiting she walks out with 2 items that we didn't order.Then another waitress comes behind her and has a order for our table and again wasn't anything close to our order. When the second waitress found out we didnt order what was brought and who our waitress was,she calls a manager over which I asked her not to do..The manager immediately turned in the order. Food was out in less than 10 minutes and it was delicious. The waitress played the blame game and was blaming the cook staff which when she brought out ticket to us, it was clear it was her fault because the ticket was incorrect. If service wasn't so horrible I would of gave 4 or 5 stars just for the food. I paid for our meal with my debit card but didn't dare add a tip onto the debit because I'm sure that was a nightmare waiting to happen.
I did leave her a $12 cash tip.

name: Jalisa Underwood
text: First time but awful experience! Food was sat on table while I was in the restroom... EVERYTHING was cold! They DNT deserve a rate but whatever

name: Mike Kase
text: New chain from Texas that was recommended by friends from Texas.  Did not disappoint!  Service was awesome, only waited 5 minutes after being quoted 30.  Food was very good.. ribeye very flavorful.  The shiner Bock bread was outstanding as well.  Will definitely go back!

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Great food and service!

name: Ann Ham
text: First time to go to Saltgrass and the service was great.  Like the water sitting on the table to refill myself.  Great idea.  We got there early so they were starting to get busy and it did not take long to get seated.  I ordered the Chicken Laredo and the chicken was chewy.  My friend who ordered the same thing she did not get Avocado on her chicken.  She did not say anything.  It was OK.  I can't say I will ever go back since it is not on my side of town and the food was not good enough to go back.  I might go back if I lived closer just to try something besides what I ordered.

name: Paul Nelson
text: Awesome! Great steaks for an affordable price.  Our waitress did a wonderful job. Maura. Clean bathrooms.  Busser attention to detail, manager checking on us was a nice touch

name: John Rozas
text: Awesome crew. Took well care of our needs. Food was superb and the steak was cook to perfection.

name: Jamarcus Simmons
text: They have decent food... excellent side dishes.. freshness was there but the main dishes lacked seasoning..... good service ... I had a very good drink...the frozen Crown and Coke.. smooth and delicious...I might go back

name: Besther Dubose
text: I was very excited about this restaurant. We haven't had many restaurants in Birmingham that can always deliver great food, great drinks and great service. This one has hit all marks 3 visits in a row. The Brisket Burger was the best I've eaten. Juicy, tender, flavorful. The Queso makes my mouth water. It comes with brisket in it but even without it, it's AMAZING.  You'll scrap the dish clean. The happy hour frozen margherita is so delicious. I can't drink it slowly. The most refreshing drink ever. And the staff makes you feel like Norm. Like they know your name. Keep doing what you do Saltgrass. I LOVE IT!!!

name: Lawanda Walker
text: Had a great time and the food was excellent! So were the drinks! And out waiter Max was VERY informative and really took great care if us!  Will be back!

name: Diane Davis
text: Food tasteless, service poor & priced high. Location & cleanliness gets 2 stars.

name: Daniel and Boo Courington
text: Good lunch experience

name: debbie ash
text: Really enjoyed this place.  I had the salmon and it was cooked perfectly.   The price was reasonable and they have really good service!

name: Besther Dubose
text: I was very excited about this restaurant. We haven't had many restaurants in Birmingham that can always deliver great food, great drinks and great service. This one has hit all marks 3 visits in a row. The Brisket Burger was the best I've eaten. Juicy, tender, flavorful. The Queso makes my mouth water. It comes with brisket in it but even without it, it's AMAZING.  You'll scrap the dish clean. The happy hour frozen margherita is so delicious. I can't drink it slowly. The most refreshing drink ever. And the staff makes you feel like Norm. Like they know your name. Keep doing what you do Saltgrass. I LOVE IT!!!

name: Jim Cnockaert
text: Had the steak salad! Excellent!

name: Antonio Smith
text: Surprisingly good fried shrimp. Love the Surf and Turf meal.

name: Simon McVey
text: Pretty good food and service. The area where we were seated was freezing and even the servers were  shivering. I'm sure this was a one off event but did certainly lessen the enjoyment of the evening

name: Daniel and Boo Courington
text: Good lunch experience

name: Clarice Powell
text:
Service was poor we had one waitress for 14 people, she was overwhelmed with us. we were there for over an hour waiting on some people to get their food. some people received food on time, the lady that I was riding with never received her food until it was time for us to leave. my check said one thing , I left a cash tip when I saw my credit card bill an extra $3 had been added to my check that was processed on my credit card they steak that I ordered look as if they had cut the top half off and I received only half of a $21 steak. Because that's all I had, was a steak my salad was small and my potato soup that I received was small,will never return because this service. what's so funny the manager or owner came out walking up and down the table talking to people but did not help to assist the one waitress who was trying her best to serve everyone it was just too much for her. service was terrible, food was late and I don't know what to say about how the tips were because my credit card should not have reflected a tip because I left cash. Never will I return to Saltgrass.
thank you

name: John Rozas
text: Awesome crew. Took well care of our needs. Food was superb and the steak was cook to perfection.

name: Ryan VanSickle
text: This a place still trying to find its identity. Prices indicate a mid range steakhouse but the atmosphere is similar to Logans or Longhorn. Service time was longer than expected, kids running around all over the restaurant, steak was average and thinner cut with an usual amount of fat. Most likely will not return. When spending around 100 dollars a couple, you should expect a certain level of service and atmosphere.

name: Tiffany “LIZ” Young
text: The wait was unreal and by the time they seated us and started bringing out our food, we were getting it boxed up because they were closing. It was 10 of us and we waited over 2 hours. Manager never came to our table to speak with us. Everybody that came in after we arrived was seated, no matter how many people were in their party. The food wasn't that good for that long of a wait. We definitely will not be going back.

name: Clarice Powell
text:
Service was poor we had one waitress for 14 people, she was overwhelmed with us. we were there for over an hour waiting on some people to get their food. some people received food on time, the lady that I was riding with never received her food until it was time for us to leave. my check said one thing , I left a cash tip when I saw my credit card bill an extra $3 had been added to my check that was processed on my credit card they steak that I ordered look as if they had cut the top half off and I received only half of a $21 steak. Because that's all I had, was a steak my salad was small and my potato soup that I received was small,will never return because this service. what's so funny the manager or owner came out walking up and down the table talking to people but did not help to assist the one waitress who was trying her best to serve everyone it was just too much for her. service was terrible, food was late and I don't know what to say about how the tips were because my credit card should not have reflected a tip because I left cash. Never will I return to Saltgrass.
thank you

name: Simon McVey
text: Pretty good food and service. The area where we were seated was freezing and even the servers were  shivering. I'm sure this was a one off event but did certainly lessen the enjoyment of the evening

name: lenora burroughs
text: OMG. The Fried Green Tomatoes Were The Best. Our Waitress was AWESOME😘

name: Jack Stevens
text: I would compare this to Logans but it's a little more upscale. The steak was good but not amazing. Staff was polite. We went at peak dinner time and the wait for two was about 20 minutes which I feel wasn't too bad. We had steak salads, bread, and one glass of wine for 56.00 including tip. We will probably go back again as we are in that area a good bit. Applebees is across the parking lot and I would have no preference between the two other than the shorter wait.

name: Mike Renta
text:
Not good.
The food didn't taste good
Service was good.
The chicken fried steak was bad, did not taste good.

name: Karissa Smith
text: My first time here and I loved my food. I ordered the Vaquero Tacos, they were delicious! I seriously wasn't expecting them to be that good but they were. I'd go back here 100 times just for those tacos. My husband ordered the Hill Country Salad and he said it was just ok. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the prices were kinda high and the other guests I was with complained about their food and wasn't impressed. My grandparents got some kind of chopped steak with brown gravy and mashed potatoes with brown gravy and the gravy wasn't good, kinda tasted like bbq sauce or something. They didn't like their food and my uncles steak was really overcooked. It also took a long time to get our food. Other than that the service was fantastic and again my food was fantastic.

name: Cedric Ambers
text: The food was delicious and the service was great. Very helpful and nice. Nice place to go on a date 😊👌

name: debbie ash
text: Really enjoyed this place.  I had the salmon and it was cooked perfectly.   The price was reasonable and they have really good service!

name: Mia*s CITY
text: Food was nasty.i asked for medium well and got nothing but pink meat. I won’t be back. Beware go to OUTBACK STEAKHOUSE FOR A REAL STEAK my first time and most definitely my last .

name: Michael Cork
text:
So, I need to update my review after a recent second visit. There won't be a third visit.

The first time I went, I sat at the bar. This time it was with a table of 6. We had appetizers which went well. We should have left after that. We ordered food and some salads. And waited........ It took a while and the food arrived. Never got our salads. He apologized for that and then brought them as well. The salads were decent. Steaks were ok, but some were so thin that there was no way to cook them correctly to temp. Of which most were medium to medium rare. The waiter did keep our drinks full and was polite. Forgetting the salads was minor. But after two attempts to try this place.... It's just not that good. We won't be back sadly. Too pricey for it to be mediocre.

Well... It was ok. Wasn't bad. But to be honest, I wanted it to be great since it is a new place. The smothered filet was very good and perfectly prepared. Ceasar salad starter was just ok. Tried the pecan bread pudding. It was huge, but it needed to be a little more warm. Never came close to melting the ice cream on top. I'll try again soon to give them a second chance. It's a good meal.

name: Ryan VanSickle
text: This a place still trying to find its identity. Prices indicate a mid range steakhouse but the atmosphere is similar to Logans or Longhorn. Service time was longer than expected, kids running around all over the restaurant, steak was average and thinner cut with an usual amount of fat. Most likely will not return. When spending around 100 dollars a couple, you should expect a certain level of service and atmosphere.

name: Mary Beth Phillips
text: The food was good but kinda pricey.  Not crowded for Sunday lunch.

name: C Johnson
text: Great service and the staff is very accommodating. My family has visited this location on two separate Sundays, and the food was really good. I had the ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. Another person in our party had the ribeye but had to send it back because it was more fat than meat. The replacement steak was perfect. Overall great place for family and friends.

name: Brooklyn Blackmon
text: I will defiantly be coming back here!! The staff was so sweet, thoughtful, and helpful! Our little was coughing and just didn’t feel well and she didn’t start until we sat down but they were all so very caring towards her and towards us!! Thank y’all!!

name: Leonnette Leavell
text: My husband & I were out Christmas shopping & decided to have lunch here. It was our first time & we were not disappointed. The atmosphere, service & food was fantastic & we'll definitely return real soon.

name: Gina Johnson
text: Obviously it's not kid friendly. Today was my first time goingw there and he was dancing and being a kid Igoin with my grandson a chill. The food was great although I had to ask the waitress for my change which was incorrect. She didn't seem happy after I called her on it! Mind you I had already left her a tip on the table. I'll still go one day in the future

name: Shawn Nguyen
text: Amazing service. I will definitely ask for Jennifer every time I come. Jennifer is honestly the best waitress I have ever had. She was beyond friendly with an amazing personality and made sure our orders were perfect. My gf is allergic to onions and when the soup came out wrong she gave us another instantly. All of our food was served in a timely manner.  I had seen reviews where people complained about their order not coming out how they wanted, but both of our steaks were perfect. Also, they may not have a bunch of different kinds of cheesecake, but their cheesecake is the best I've had. Even better than cheesecake factory. Not to mention, Jennifer was able to throw in some extra strawberry glaze just because she could tell my gf really liked it. Excellent customer service. Also, she informed us about the Landry's Service Club which is really great, if your waiter doesn't inform you about it- you  should ask. It has some awesome perks and the manager was very friendly and personally came to our table to give us our new card and answer any questions. 10/10.

name: Asabi Muhammad
text: Excellent Food, Service, and Beverages!! Will definitely be returning 😋

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Great food, as I've come to expect.  Yeah, SG can be pricy, depending on what you order.  But, there are plenty of affordable items on the menu.  The manager perceived that my food was taking longer expected to arrive and took the initiative to personally come to my table to apologize.  I wish everyone were so conscientious.  I'll definitely be going back soon!

name: Dee Man
text: Carrot cake is the bomb 💣. So good and homemade

name: Benjamin L
text: Always great food and service. Really good steaks.

name: Angelia Bowdre
text: First thing right off, the wait time is less than the wait time at the saltgrass on 280. Great service, good food and attentive service from the manager. Their steaks ARE ahhhhhh! Don't sleep on them!  Give them a try!!

name: Nick Casiday
text: The service was a little shaky, we sat at our table for a while before being greeted and then the order wasnt quite right when it came out. The food is good, but not for the price. The steak was on par with mid tier steakhouses, but costs more than I would have expected. It has the ubiquitous decorative clutter. The staff was very friendly, but there are other chain steakhouses I prefer.

name: PJ sivley
text: They have great steaks and they've been cooked exactly the way I ordered them. They was really nice and made sure everything was to your liking. Then they've got some really good deserts.

name: Carl Underwood
text: One of the best Ribeyes I've ever had in my life.

name: Robin Lewis
text: Our first time eating at the just opened Saltgrass steak business.. The atmosphere was great. The staff were very helpful and I couid tell they had  been trained professionally. Food was incredible best steak house and you will love.

name: Mickesia
text: The food is great. We waited over two hours because they only have a small section to accommodate large parties. We were never updated about our table, we weren't asked if we were ok, people came and went. When we asked the manager about the wait,  she said that she'd already told us it would be a long wait. So 1 hour and 20 minutes is what we were told but after 2hours we finally got seated. All we wanted was for some one to at least periodically check on us, let us know were we stood. They could have accommodated with free appetizers or something. Food was great but  good customer service is always better. I may revisit this place and maybe not... I give it a 3 for poor leadership.

name: Micheal Spann
text:
Good steak and good service.
Our waitress Angelika was very nice and attentive.

name: Kim Kollmeyer
text: Food is great the cheesecake is so good.

name: Gina Key
text: Steaks are always good and service as well. Jesus was on waiter and he was very good

name: Fred Sherrill
text: The host we had was very rude, we waited 45 minutes for a table and when we finally got one there wasn't even enough room for my wife and I. We requested a different table and the host said it would be another 30 minute wait. Never got a chance to see if the food was good. Hopefully my next visit will be better.

name: Sandra Lyle
text: We took my 73 year old mother-in- law for her Birthday. She had been wanting a really good steak. She ordered the Tbone. I got ribs and my husband got a ribeye. We paid over $100 and it would be completely worth it if the food was good. But it was not. The steak had good flavor , but was very tough and too much gristle. My mother-in-law could barely cut and eat her T-bone. My husband’s ribeye was very small and my ribs were so tough I couldn’t eat them. I love the bbq sauce and the food looked good, just not the quality expected. I mentioned to server about my ribs, they were not falling off bone as stated in menu. She responded , “ they usually are”.  The salad was not that good either, with lettuce was ice cold and brown. Plus we went early, so not a large crowd, but still had to wait and spotty service. I wish I had taken pictures! We have eaten here in the past and enjoyed it. I hate we wasted a birthday lunch and paid so much for such a disappointing meal.

name: Monique Smith
text: Very nice atmosphere, wait-staff is friendly and efficient.  Steaks are wonderfully seasoned and cooked.  Ribs were fall off the bone tender.  Overall a very nice dining experience.

name: Chris Wade
text: Best steak around! Good friendly service.

name: Barbara Pulliam
text: This is always a place I come to eat when I visit this area!  The food and service is always great!  I have never had an issue at this restaurant and love the food!

name: Sharifah Eltahir
text: The 150 location was packed! However, my husband and I got seated in less than 15 minutes of a 20-30 minute wait. Our food was on point! If anyone has ever experienced an off night, please give it a second chance! Our server Lena was very thorough and checked in on our table consistently! The ambience is a comfortable one and very welcoming. This was a wonderful night and a great restaurant choice to celebrate my Birthday! We will DEFINITELY be back soon!!

name: Tamieka Ragland
text: My server was extremely nice

name: La Shonda Reid
text: The food is EXCELLENT! THE SERVICE IS ONE OF THE BEST!

name: Chanse LaShai
text: Phenomenal food, steak was exactly as I asked. However, it took an hour and half for my table to get their food. People came in behind us and had already eaten and left before we received our food. Great atmosphere, felt as if we were in the living room of family members.

name: Joyce Segers
text: The first time I visited was right after it opened...the food was pretty good, I had a steak, they are a little pricey, service was not so good, they weren't really that busy,  and the manager had to take our order.  The second time was just OK. I had a salad and it was pretty good, my Dad however ordered the ribs and they were terrible, very tough. The server was hard to catch. The manager did comp our meal, but for the price, they do need to up their quality and their service.  Still contemplating whether or not I will give them another chance, probably not.

name: Mohamad Hassoun
text: I had a rib eye with mashed potatoes. Cooked amazingly. Good customer service.

name: Samuel Kent
text: A wonderful addition to the area. Great food and impeccable service make this restaurant a great value for the money. Easily the best steak in this part of town, and every aspect of the dining experience is enjoyable.

name: Billy Helmandollar
text: Great food and dining experience.  I would recommend if you like steak or ribs as everything we ordered was fantastic.

name: Jamie Aaron
text: OMG!! Everything was amazing!! Best steak I've ever eaten..

name: Chris Goodgame
text: Awesome

name: Raynu Shakur
text: Slooooow

name: J Shady
text: Good steak, cooked just right, and we'll seasoned vegetables.

name: Jeff Chappell
text: First trip to Saltgrass. Waitress was great, food was good. We will go back!!!

name: L Locke
text:
Absolutely delicious and fantastic service!
We didn't have a single complaint about our meal or drinks.

name: Sheila Niblett
text: My steak was ordered, medium. When it came out it was, well done. My family had ate their food by the time a manager came over..So, he took my dinner off the check...My family enjoyed their food. We would go back and give them another chance..

name: william m
text: Great food and nice people

name: Niki Welch
text: Love love this place the one on Hoover that is the one on 280 not so much but the bartender in Hoover she works lunch the bomb the cooks are awesome never a complaint

name: Kevin Gardner
text:
I really had high hopes for this restaurant. The wife and I went with two other friends today around 4:00. Let me get the good out of the way. The decor and atmosphere are great. Check-in is nice in that they call you via text. That's about it.

Ok, the bad. Parking is horrendous even on an off time. Our server was incredibly inattentive, borderline rude. The food... well, it was... cold. We got steaks and the butter never fully melted on top of them, folks. I shouldn't be surprised, but the wife was sick when she got home. My stomach is currently giving me the warning notice that I may not be too far behind.

Seriously, there are much better venues I will be spending my time and money on in the future. Shameful in almost every way, Saltgrass. I am only giving two stars for the pleasant entrance and seating. Everything else was a disaster.

name: Keldrick Pritchett
text: The cheese fries with sour cream very delicious

name: Brandon Hannon
text: Erin McKinnon is amazing!!!! Great service. Very personable. She made the experience for me. Will be back soon!

name: Keisha Brown
text: I love steak and decided to give this restaurant a try. The service was horrible. The waiter by the name of Zack took 30+ mins to bring silverware. We literally had our salads and nothing to eat them with. When I looked around the dining area, we were the only tsble without bread. Zack finally brought bread out, along with the silverware unwrapped. He began placing the silverware on the bare table. My steak was well done, when I ordered medium well. Zack took the steak back and in less than 2 minutes, the manager came back with the same steak I sent back stating" well this is our medium well and the outside will always be well done". I told her I wasn't satisfied and that the steak was OVER COOKED. I will never return to that establishment again. Good customer service goes a long way in my book, and frankly, they lacked it.

name: Christine AlabamaMom
text: Having a severe seafood allergy to shellfish, it is difficult to be able to go out and enjoy a meal. However, at this location, they went above and beyond in order to be able to prepare food for me, and checked in on us to make sure that all was well. 😁 Our server Michael was very helpful and friendly & Destiny was awesome 🍽

name: Key Wilson
text: I have visited several Saltgrass locations and the one in Hoover has the best customer service. The arrival of all food was timed perfectly from the salads to the desserts. My favorite dish is the chicken Laredo it is a must try. You won’t be disappointed in the food or the awesome customer service.

name: Kenny Brown
text: This place was great.  Had the Gulf Coast Steak and Shrimp.  It was really good.  The service was great also.  Will definitely be going back.

name: Dana Brown
text: This was our first time here. Food was great...everyone got something different and it all ws good. Services was great.

name: Renee Coleman
text: The Food And Service And the Drinks Are The Best.

name: Brandy Bradford
text: Loved it! Our server was awesome! Food was great..atmosphere was good. Will definitely be back!

name: Cheryl Tarver
text: The waiters were very good and nice. The food was delicious 😋. We were very happy and it is hard to please my family ❤️. Thanks for a very good experience. We will be going back.

name: Diane Roper
text: Food was great. Service was good.

name: Austin Sandow
text: Took the waitress about 5 minutes before she even acknowledged us. She finally took our order and after 10 minutes of no drinks we asked for the manager gave it another 2 or 3 mins waiting for the manager and we just told the hostess to cancel the order and walked out the door.  Also kinda of a limited selection and pricey.

name: Willie Barren
text: The food was very good. The parking area was too full and customers who made reservations had a difficult time finding a parking spot. Good atmosphere and the servers were very nice. The prices were a bit expensive.

name: Scott King
text: I cannot recommend this restaurant because the quality of the steaks since their opening has fallen off to the point that I wouldn't waste the money to buy another steak there. The wait staff are very pleasant people but they're being forced to serve food that is not worth the price

name: Patricia Gans
text: Nice atmosphere, friendly people and good food.

name: Jackie Ryan Rankin
text: The only reason for it being a three star is because our service (Jennifer) was awesome! I had my birthday celebration here last night (February 17) and it was the worst food prepared wrong and cooked even worse. I’ve eaten at Saltgrass in Texas many times and had an amazing experience and even better food so to see it come to Alabama, I WAS thrilled but after getting sick and the terrible customer service by the Manager (Amy) I doubt that I will return to this location. Everyone in our party was disgusted by the food and the lack of compassion by the manager.

name: William RIker
text: The Best Steak I have ever put in my mouth, Ever! My new default steak resturant!

name: Greg Edgeworth
text: Very good shrimp! Kelly (NOLA) Very nice,  and great service!

name: Cathy Brown
text: Kitchen was very slow--both the steak and chicken were overcooked-- just poorly prepared--server was good--I eat out often, and I will likely pass on dining here again. Save your $70 (for 2 entrees & 2 cocktails)--Atmosphere reminded me of Quincy's Steakhouse (from back in the day) with a facelift

name: K C (LakeLover)
text: My husband and I both ordered a hamburger.  They were OK.  Buns were very soggy.  We might give this another try, but would not order the burgers again.  There are so many other good burger places in Birmingham.  I thought service was average.  Bread was served cold instead of warm.  Prices seem a bit high for what is being offered.  For the price, I would rather go to FireBird.

name: Ree Ree
text: I really didn't order anything that night ....went to a proposal's dinner & left afterwards but staff was fast with taking drink orders .... had 3 ppl helping to speed up service.

name: jamuriel hall
text: The experience was horrible tonight ... I had a waiter name  kierra  we ordered once we got the food my ribs was cold shortly after the manger was on the floor I asked Stephaine which was the head manger she replaced the ribs and baked potato when she replaced the ribs they bought it out but the potato was cold... shortly after me and my party waited an additional 35 minutes that’s when I asked our waiter who never came and checked on us after that long period of time can she assist her name was Gabby she then apologize and said she’ll take 10$ off the bill this was the worst experience at this location my waiter kierra said because she had a big party she thought they gave us another waiter horrible experience ... I will be reaching out to the GM!!!!!

name: Iris Brown
text: The food and drinks were amazing the server was excellent I had the tenderloin tips with mashed potatoes that cognac sauce was to die for so rich with flavor and a side of sauteed brussel sprouts with bacon were delicious and I had my go to drink the grilled pineapple margarita as usual and it didn't let me down

name: John Cockrell
text: Had baby back ribs, garlic mashed potatoes, and salad. Great meal, and fine service. Wife had grilled salmon. First time visit, and we will return.

name: Terilyn Stewart
text: Nice place to eat. Only reason I gave 4 stars is because an employee fell twice because the floors we slippery and when management was told the mats were missing and management decided to argue in front of customers. Management was clearly in the wrong because the floors were slippery and mats were definitely NOT there, some mats were out but not enough to cover the floor. The tile is pretty to look at but that kind of tile is not suitable.

name: Lori Acres
text: My Uncle had tea poured into his coke. Terrible potato soup. 2 virgin Bloody Marty’s were terrible and had to be sent back. Asked for bread 3 times to no avail.

name: rochelle weems
text: Its good food but I think for the price and portions you would be better off going to longhorns steakhouse. The ambience and the atmosphere was that of Longhorns..the bread and honey butter was very good..and the steak was very good..Can't really distinguish any different taste than longhorns but pricing was definitely higher. Me and hubby shared a porterhouse and bought extra wedge salads, and split a potato, and bought 3 kids meals which are higher..We paid $63.74 and split our meal..but going to longhorns you wouldn't of had to spit anything. So use your best judgement.

name: Rosalyn Ford
text: Our waitress was on point all evening.  Food was great.  Price, you get what you pay for.  Enough said.

name: Paige Logan
text: This place is Magnificent ❤️

name: J C-A
text: Very Busy, Crowded and could be more attentive to their customers! 1st time going but I'm hoping that will change! Steak was cooked to perfection and the Long Island Tea was Super Good!

name: Sharonda Hackett
text: Service and Food not Good

resp.text: Hi Sharonda. We are always looking for ways to improve and would appreciate any feedback you would be willing to provide at the link below. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: nicole harris
text: Our order was completely wrong and the steak was not cooked to order, the steak was supposed to have been medium well it was medium. The managers did not apologize for the mix up. The took the order back and fixed and added another meal to our ticket. We were seated at out table about 6:30 p.m. when I asked the waiter about any specials he only mentioned at drink that was regular price. After we paid the check I specifically asked if they had happy hour and he stated yes from 3 pm to 6 pm. Then he asked if I wanted to see a happy hour menu. After reading over the menu happy hour was from 3 pm to 7 pm and I brought this to his attention and he stated that I did not ask and that it was only for the bar not the tables. We had ordered two of the appetizers that was offered during happy hour.

name: Charles Cothren
text: Beat Steak I have had in Birmingham in over a year. Thank you Saltgrass for 5 Star Taste and 1st class steaks. Only one thing you need to do, enlarge dinning room so wait will not be quite so long

name: Jennifer Kremer
text:
Staff not on duty congregating and eating in the dining room. Very slow Service with more staff SOCIALIZING than waiting tables. Food came out with Brussel sprouts cold, steak overdone,  potato 1/2 dressed. This is not an anomaly. This is my 3rd visit and it never improves. Just to note, this was not peak time. Approx 2:15 on Sunday afternoon. Restaurant was not busy at all.  Poor management or bad kitchen staff.  Who knows? The server I had was  handling several tables and was doing all she could. I finally asked for my meal to be corrected and  packaged to go. I will not return.  When the check was delivered there was no concession made for the poor food or time I waited. I paid the check tipped 20% and will not return. Longhorn will get ny future business
even though the drive is an additional 15 minutes.

name: Gerald Reid
text: Our service was subpar. He had a very rude demeanor. Food was great though!

name: sammy D
text: Great waitstaff,  fair prices.

name: Maria Dean
text: Food was delicious and service was great!!

name: Jennifer Bye
text: Always a favorite.

name: Kenneth White
text: Great place, great food, a bit pricey, but worth it...

name: Callie Cohen
text: I can’t begin to tell you how wonderful my service was from Parker the other day. I’ve never had more pleasant company and felt taken care of during a meal in my life. My appetizer took entirely too long to  come out and it was perfectly clear the management offers no support to the wait staff or kitchen because no one but my server gave a damn wether I ate or not.

name: Tim Scott
text: Our group had a great meal, but my pork chop was the best!  First time there, but I will definitely be back!

name: Zach Black
text: Amazing food better staff

name: Chris 2018enjoying_life
text: Wait time was a little long but the food was delicious.

name: Tiffany
text: This place has a variety of items to choose from on the menu...I had the steak and shrimp and it was delicious..The waitress was very nice & pleasant.

name: Joseph Woodham
text: Excellent menu selection,  good food, good service, good ATMOSPHERE. Enjoyed the visit

name: Amanda Robinson
text: Amazing customer service top notch food

name: Larry w
text: Visited 9/1/2020. Was never seated, no one ever came to the front, we tried to get the only waiter we saw attention, never looked to the front. We waited quite a awhile, got fed up and left.

name: Jennifer Kremer
text:
Staff not on duty congregating and eating in the dining room. Very slow Service with more staff SOCIALIZING than waiting tables. Food came out with Brussel sprouts cold, steak overdone,  potato 1/2 dressed. This is not an anomaly. This is my 3rd visit and it never improves. Just to note, this was not peak time. Approx 2:15 on Sunday afternoon. Restaurant was not busy at all.  Poor management or bad kitchen staff.  Who knows? The server I had was  handling several tables and was doing all she could. I finally asked for my meal to be corrected and  packaged to go. I will not return.  When the check was delivered there was no concession made for the poor food or time I waited. I paid the check tipped 20% and will not return. Longhorn will get ny future business
even though the drive is an additional 15 minutes.

name: Rita Jones
text: Hmmm good! Enjoy the experience. Ambiance was nice. Service was good. Future visit for sure.

name: Lori Acres
text: My Uncle had tea poured into his coke. Terrible potato soup. 2 virgin Bloody Marty’s were terrible and had to be sent back. Asked for bread 3 times to no avail.

name: Maria Dean
text: Food was delicious and service was great!!

name: Steven Miller
text: Steak was delicious. Service was pretty good as well. Had a wonderful time. Aww

name: Renee Coleman
text: The Food And Service And the Drinks Are The Best.

name: Zach Black
text: Amazing food better staff

name: Sharonda Hackett
text: Service and Food not Good

resp.text: Hi Sharonda. We are always looking for ways to improve and would appreciate any feedback you would be willing to provide at the link below. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: LaTreda Johnson
text: I love love love Saltgrass! Their grilled pineapple margaritas are the best. Their rib eye steaks are to dye for and their stuffed jalapenos are sent from heaven!

name: Kenneth White
text: Great place, great food, a bit pricey, but worth it...

name: Steven Miller
text: Steak was delicious. Service was pretty good as well. Had a wonderful time. Aww

name: Crystal Calhoun
text: Great service

name: Edward Myers
text: Great food best service I ever had try 16 oz Pat rib eye

name: Roger Higginbotham
text:
We did call-ahead seating for 7:00pm. We got text message at 6:00pm saying our table was ready. We called back at 6:30 and reconfirmed our seating for 7:00. Arrived at 6:50 and was told it would be a few minutes.  At 7:45 they still hadn’t seated us and was then told they couldn’t find our reservation.
We were finally seated and then the service was slow. On top of that the food was cold when it got to the table. Ordered two T-bones, one was think and looked like a good steak, but was over cooked and cold. The other one was really thin but cooked to the right temperature but was cold when it got to the table also. I’m sure both were the same weight, or they were supposed to be, but a thick juicy 17oz steak is much better than a large extra thin 17oz steak any day. The thin one looked like something from Waffle House.
I know this place isn’t in the same league as Ruth’s Chris steak house, and I wasn’t expecting it to be, but it’s not even up to Texas Roadhouse level.
The manager came over and apologized but made no offer to make it right, not even to cook new steaks.
Definitely not wasting my time or money coming here again.

text: The tea and milk were great, hostesses were nice, and the frozen Crown/ Coke was good. My husband and I both had undercooked food (pork chop and a burger)...disappointing, but I understand that it happens occasionally. I requested that my food be cooked to the temp that was originally requested and was given a spiel about smoked pork not cooking completely when close to the bone.   The pork approximately 1 inch from the bone was the equivalent of a medium steak... I dine out often and usually have a fully cooked thick cut pork chop (so I didn't appreciate the false lesson). Our waitress seemed to be a bit peeved by any requests that were made by us (extra napkins, refills, etc) unlike the waiter who took our drink orders when we sat down.I wanted to like this restaurant because I heard great things about the other location in B'ham. Hopefully the food and service will improve as the crowd thins 🤷🏻‍♀️

name: Mandy Hartley
text:
Where do I begin? So many mistakes, several made more than twice, and everyone had an excuse or wanted to blame it on their other “team” members.

First, my son had to ask for sweet tea twice. Both times he was brought unsweet tea. When we complained that the second glass wasn’t sweet either, she tried to act like it was my personal definition of “sweet” that was wrong. They figured out someone neglected to actually put the sweetener in but never apologized. And then tried to charge us $3 for it when it was included in the kid’s meal. They also tried to charge $3.40 for my daughter’s milk that was supposed to be included AFTER being told to remove the charge. Second, my coffee that I ordered when I arrived was cold and I had to wait 10 minutes for a replacement AFTER asking for it AGAIN. Another excuse was given when asked why the coffee wasn’t kept hot in the kitchen.

Last, what is most upsetting is how we were made to feel when making our complaints. I know it’s a fairly new restaurant at that location. I get that there are certain mistakes that happen at any restaurant (like forgetting lemons in the water which also happened tonight). What I don’t get is how 3 or 4 people on their “team” could make us feel like we were difficult customers when it was their repeated mistakes that led us to complain! And never once did they offer to compensate. In fact, they tried to charge us for their mistakes! I would have rather eaten at Chick-fil-A where my business is appreciated. My family will not be going back.

Just so you know, this is my first time ever to leave a bad review for anyone. I don’t do this as a hobby. I’ve never felt so disrespected at a restaurant before.

I've been to this location twice and I had two different experiences:

Visit 1) Ordered the sirloin with veggies. The veggies we're excellent 👌. The sirloin however, was ok. It was a bit bland and just barely cooked over what I ordered (medium rare). Naturally sirloins are a lean meat and it's difficult to keep this cut tender if not cooked rare/medium-rare. Nonetheless I did enjoy my food and the service was decent.

Visit 2) Ordered the ribeye and garlic mashed potatoes (I know it's completely opposite from the last meal). The mashed potatoes were fantastic. The ribeye though, MAN! That ribeye was an excellent steak and seasoned to perfection. Ribeyes are one of the fattiest cuts and they can be cooked well done while maintaining tenderness. I got mine medium rare. I highly recommend that dish.

Overall this place has a great atmosphere, the service was good, and the food has a good range. As a general rule I give 4 stars if a place meets my expectations and 5 if it exceeds my expectations. I give 4 here only because I had inconsistent experiences.

name: Mandy Hartley
text:
Where do I begin? So many mistakes, several made more than twice, and everyone had an excuse or wanted to blame it on their other “team” members.

First, my son had to ask for sweet tea twice. Both times he was brought unsweet tea. When we complained that the second glass wasn’t sweet either, she tried to act like it was my personal definition of “sweet” that was wrong. They figured out someone neglected to actually put the sweetener in but never apologized. And then tried to charge us $3 for it when it was included in the kid’s meal. They also tried to charge $3.40 for my daughter’s milk that was supposed to be included AFTER being told to remove the charge. Second, my coffee that I ordered when I arrived was cold and I had to wait 10 minutes for a replacement AFTER asking for it AGAIN. Another excuse was given when asked why the coffee wasn’t kept hot in the kitchen.

Last, what is most upsetting is how we were made to feel when making our complaints. I know it’s a fairly new restaurant at that location. I get that there are certain mistakes that happen at any restaurant (like forgetting lemons in the water which also happened tonight). What I don’t get is how 3 or 4 people on their “team” could make us feel like we were difficult customers when it was their repeated mistakes that led us to complain! And never once did they offer to compensate. In fact, they tried to charge us for their mistakes! I would have rather eaten at Chick-fil-A where my business is appreciated. My family will not be going back.

Just so you know, this is my first time ever to leave a bad review for anyone. I don’t do this as a hobby. I’ve never felt so disrespected at a restaurant before.

name: 2 Badcats
text: This was our first time at Saltgrass Steakhouse, but definitely not our last. The first two locations in our area recently opened, so we were anxious to try it out. We had lunch there last Friday. We skipped the appetizers after seeing the meals being served at tables nearby (very large portions). I did have a Grilled Pineapple Margarita, one of the featured drinks, and it was awesome! If it had been a little later, I would have had several more. I selected the 5 oz. bacon wrapped filet ($19.99) with salad & baked potato (there is a $2.49 up charge for the baked potato at lunch). My meal was delicious. My husband had the ribeye ($18.99, I think) with salad and garlic mashed potatoes. His meal was delicious as well, and when we go back, I will have the ribeye myself. It was one of the best ribeyes we've had. For dessert, we shared some kind of brownie/cookie skillet  with ice cream that was incredible and probably actually big enough for 4 to share. The service was excellent as well. All in all, a great experience & we will definitely go there again.

name: Maribel
text:
PROS, CONS, AND FINAL VERDICT....
Pro:
Customer service was great.  We had issues with an overcooked steak and they offered to put another on the grill.  We denied because the one we had was good but it was not how we ordered, which was our fault we tried something new and it backfired.  Anyway, I loved it.  Patrick was a great waiter.  Atmosphere is great, decor was entertaining, and the place was clean.  I didn't go to the restrooms so I can't comment on that.  There is alot of parking but even with that said, we had to drive around looking for parking on a Sunday afternoon at 2:30pm.  My husband even said that made him want to eat there even more because it meant it was good.  We were not disappointed.  It was delicious.  No sure if there is wifi but either way, it's a restaurant enjoy the company you went with and/or the decor around.  Disconnect if you can, it's worth it.
Side note:  I would have given 4.5 rating if I could.  Con was not so bad to give a full blank star  but I could't do that.  So it is what it is...
Con:
Place was HOT!!  I am usually cold natured and it was hot even for me.  My husband couldn't take off any more layers.  Our waiter was sweating and so were other people around us.  It was a bit disgusting.  Our waiter was a good sport though.
FINAL VERDICT:
WE WILL BE BACK.  REALLY ENJOYED IT!  TRY IT!

text:
The only thing here, I want improved is the pies; were they canned?  They also have a cake, cookies and puddings.
Most of their food is very good with a wide selection; fried, baked, meats, vegetables, salads.  My husband's favorite is Waldorf salad.
Service is excellent.
I always get plenty to eat at a reasonable price.

name: C J
text: FIRST OFF THIS PLACE HAS AMAZING FOOD, SERVICE ALL FOR A EXCELLENT PRICE!!! who doesn't love this all you can eat buffet. The salad bar is AMAZING with so many choices! The meatloaf is to die for. And Rodneys baked beans are too good to pass up! The kitchen staff is super friendly and eager to help. The waitresses are amazing. I honestly don't think you can not go in here and get bad service. I never have!!! Tuesdays senior days are a bit busy. But the BREAKFAST BUFFET IS TO DIE FOR! MUCH BETTER THEN SHONEYS OR CRACKER BARREL!!!!  Sunday is definitely the best day to go! Sunday dinner at it's finest. Not to mention the owner being our there being more then happy to work along side his employees just as hard! KUDOS!!

name: Nikki Krachinski
text: This is an amazing place to go to. They have a huge variety of food. And it all taste amazing. The people are nice and friendly. text: Very busy but it's mothers day..Steak was dry and tuff.Salad fish and rolls were awesome..Servers were friendly..

name: Alex Gilbreath
text: So I came here lastnight and walked in the door at 8:40. Just 20 minutes before they close, told them if I was to late it was no problem I didn’t want to keep the staff later than they would already be. Well they said it’s no problem at all sat me down and I went to pigging out. Now the part about it all is I’m a truck driver I drove well over my fare share of time today, when I asked if I could park my truck and trailer in the lot for the night the young lady said let me get my manager I’m not sure. The manager came out and said absolutely you can you are more than welcome anytime you come through here to park your truck and trailer and eat. We talked for a good hour at this point only to find out he is in fact the owner. When it came time to leave, he refused my money and said it was no good here due to the work that goes into trucking and everything that goes on in my industry. For the first time in all the years of driving this man was the first person other than family to actually show appreciation and when I got to the truck I was still amazed. I will forever support this business and will make sure I let everybody know how friendly the place is, how wonderful the staff is, and how good the food was. If you haven’t been here come see all my new friends at western sizzlin.

name: Becki Grossheim

text: Giving "1" Star to the waitress. She kept our glasses full and checked on us regularly. The food on the other hand was pitiful. I am just now trying my 11 month old on food and I thought this would be a nice place to give her mashed potatoes and a few other things but personally I wouldn't feed my dog this food. The rolls were hard as a rock. Youu used to have and option on steak as far as how it's cooked but it's only cooked one way. I literally choked on the the marshmellows in their sweet potato casserole . And don't get me start on the salad. They have no banana peppers and what looked like bagged lettuce where they used to have choice of spinach. I am very dissatisfied and disappointed , After this terrible experience, we were paying our tab and the hostess was very rude when asked if there was a change in the management.Needless to say, I will not be coming back to this place.

name: Barbara Allen
text: Fabulous offerings for the money. If they are not serving grilled Tilapia fillets, ask, and they can cook some especially for you. I love their stir-fried green beans, zucchini and squash slices. If I don't see fresh apples offered as a healthy alternative on the dessert island, I ask Jason for a fresh apple and he will give me one. I love to go there when I want healthy food (not fried) to eat. The salad bar is a great place to get a nice salad, too. Always friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and appreciated. Oh! And they have a special Senior Discount on Tuesday afternoon before 5PM, too.
