name: russell kilby
text: EXTREMELY DISPLEASED!!! I won’t write a long drawn out review, but I do want to inform customers, and hopefully the owners about my experience. Staff and hostess were very polite. Came in for a birthday party. Wife was not feeling well, so she just got a small side salad from the salad bar.  We had a large party, and her drink was overlooked and never brought. No big deal, I informed the waitress, and was told we would not be charged. The food was for lack of better words ABSOLUTELY NOT GOOD!! I ate a few bites, and lost my appetite. Decided maybe the dessert would be better. Got some icecream, and it tasted strange and was runny like water. Asked the waitress about it, and was told it is because it is a powdered icecream that is mixed with water. I was amazed. I took it that the waitresses must get complaints daily because of how  not surprised they were when asked about the quality.   Got the bill, and of course while splitting the checks it was overlooked and we were charged for full buffet and drink. Went to pay, and informed the person of what happened. Was told she did not have a manager card to override it, but would gladly go speak to the manager. She came back, apologized, and said that she was sorry, but the manager was doing the schedule, and told her that he was busy, and if she bothered him again he would close the door. Now, he may have been kidding with her, but either way, he never came out to help her, or to address the issue. She said she was sorry, but without the card, there was nothing she could do. So I had to pay 37 dollars for a salad, one drink, and the small plate I ate. It is the principal that I was told that I would have to pay for something that I never received, and the manager who’s job it is to handle issues, decided he did not feel like walking 20 feet to talk me. I want to also state that I called back and spoke to mr. Rodney. AWESOME guy! He apologized, and was very professional. Just wanted to make that clear in case anyone that works at the store sees this post. Will not post the manager in questions name, because that is even more unprofessional than he is. I will say though, it was the guy working around 3pm on this past Saturday. The one doing next weeks schedule. Also, I will be contacting corporate tomorrow, to inform them of my experience, and see if they will be kind enough to refund the difference that I was overcharged. Usually do not write negative reviews, but it does not sit well with me to be charged for something I never received, and be told that I would have to pay for it because the manager does not feel like being bothered to come do what he is paid to do. So, I do apologize sir, but I WILL be telling corporate your name. Gotta get my money’s worth!!! Take care, and enjoy the 9 dollars you stole from me!!!

resp.text: I apologize for you experience and our failure to meet your expectations. If you will please contact Jason at the store 256.442.5061

The vegetables I enjoyed were the collard greens, sweet corn and green beans, broccoli and sweet carrots. As for the salad bar it was good. The service staff were very kind. As for the desserts My mom and her friend loved the cheese cake, it reminded them of a New York cheese cake. I liked their pecan pie it was good to my liking.

name: James Owens
text: The restaurant was dirty from one end to the other. There was food, paper and dirt on the floor from one end to the other. the salt and pepper shakers had so much gunk on them that  I dared not even touch them. The Fried Chicken was obviously cooked in oil that was old and burnt I'm gagging now just thinking about it writing this post and mashed potatoes believe it or not you can slice it like a pie it was so thick and starchy. The macaroni and cheese was just a blob of cheese and mushed up pasta. The rice was crunchy the steak was either dried out chunks of beef jerky are raw uncooked meat. I was there for about 45 minutes and the only ribs that were on the bar was bones only no meat just a pile of bones with barbecue sauce. they never even replaced it. And bless don't forget about the 10 corn kernels that was in the bottom of a pan on the bar for 45 minutes not replaced and God forbid we forget about those nasty pieces of brownie that tasted like a cardboard box that had been set out for a month and I go back to the beginning let's just say but the place was nasty probably one of the dirtiest restaurants have been in recently and how they made a 92 on their health score I don't know I think the health inspector was just being kind now a word about the service we ordered our drinks went to the bar got a plate come back we were nearly done with the first plate and we finally got our drinks it's tea people is not that hard you pour it into a cup and bring it to the table. I finally gave up on finding something that was edible set there for 15 minutes waiting on a ticket to go pay this place used to be really good of course I'm thinking back to about 10 years ago.

name: Anna Parks
text: My family & I were on our way home from a trip. We saw this Western Sizzlin while passing thru and thought we'd try it. About 15mins later we regretted this decision. We stood waiting on a hostess to seat us for awhile. The hostess looked at us... and then started doing something else. (We should have left then). Finally she came up and seated us. The silverware she gave us was dirty. Our waitress was nice, but the water she served us tasted like chlorine, so we had to get sodas instead. Everything tasted the same: blah. I noticed the bits of meat in the turnip greens & cabbage looked grey and smelt bad. Many of the veggies had the faint taste of chlorine. The meat was dry. Minutes after eating some meat, my father got sick. After getting some soft serve ice cream (which was the best thing they had) we were ready for our ticket. It was $49 for three people!! We went ahead and paid it. But it was truly a terrible experience. Advice: Don't eat here.

name: renea lawman
text:
Terrible, awful, bad.
I got the food bar.  The steak on the bar was either RAW....OR  OVER DONE..... I asked the young cook if he could cook a few pieces a little more and he picked up the whole tray and dumped it back on the grill with a snotty attitude.  The beef roast was med rare nice, but cold.  I can say the pot roast was good but $12 for roast is a bit much.  The desserts are awful.  They need to have something home made.  This Western sizzlin has gone downhill quickly.
My husband got the chopped steak.  He likes his medium well.  In other words cooked moist but not BURNED.  The FIRST one they brought him was only brown on the very outside.  It was not pink it was RED on the inside.  The waitress apologized and ordered him another one.  35 minutes later she brought him one so burned you could have used it to clean the grates on the grill.
I really hate to be so UGLY but this visit was terrible awful discussing.

name: Stan Cookieman
text:
We've eaten at this Western Sizzlin' on many occasions. Even when we've lived away and returned for visits, we've actually made it a part of our plans when planning where to eat. Obviously, it's an older restaurant and has been remodeled a few times, and even underwent extensive remodeling after a fire. We've noticed there seems to be a slight burned odor lingering since the fire. Other than that, to us, it doesn't smell dirty. The food has always been quite good. In fact, some of their food is better than other (more expensive) places. For the most part the service is above average. It depends on who waits on you. There are several members of the wait staff who've been serving customers for decades, and they give great service, while some of the novices could improve. It could be cleaner, but in our opinion, it isn't as dirty as some make it out to be. It is much cleaner than the Ryan's or Quincy's Steakhouses which were once here. There must be some reason Western Sizzlin' has outlasted those places by several years! They were here before those others and they're still here, long after the others have closed down.

We're not related to any of the owners or employees. We're just loyal customers who feel as if they've been represented unfairly in some of these reviews.
